text: Had the ruby salad, carpaccio, salmon, and ravioli...... everything was literally amazing. We had an amazing server as well. I have not one thing bad to say about this restaurant.
The food was great, music is inspiring and Marco our server is very knowledgeable of the food they serve, he's very pleasant. We will definitely bring our friends and family here.

Great, fresh, flavorful food. A unique menu with multiple dishes that you don't see elsewhere. 

My new go to Italian place.

Great atmosphere and friendly staff - service was good. Only odd thing was putting fries on the kids pizza, led to a soggy bottom layer of fries. Pasta was cooked perfectly (it is surprising how many Italian restaurants can't get the pasta right).

The bartender and atmosphere were wonderful. Unfortunately, the waiter was very unresponsive and the food was not enjoyable. I will give tons of credit to the owner, who tried to pitch in when needed.

We checked out this new restaurant in our neighborhood. I was surprised at the beautiful, interior. I didn't expect it to be so elegant inside. It's also very clean looking. The servers are courteous and friendly. And the owner himself visits the tables to ask if everything is okay. Food and presentation are good. The wait is reasonable time. We'd like to return and try other dishes. I think we're going to be regular customers.

My husband and I ordered dinner to go. Dinner came with what seemed like an entire loaf of bread and incredible herb infused dipping sauce! We had the half moon butternut squash "ravioli." The sage and butter sauce was incredible. The chocolate cake was also so delicious and we are not even huge chocolate fans. We cannot wait to go back and dine!

I've been here a few times and I'm truly blown away. Staff is attentive and friendly. I really enjoyed the lobster supreme . It was so tasty and the lobster was tender and delicious. I also enjoyed the ravioli in an asparagus cream sauce! I'll be going make soon for sure!

In our opinion, this is the best Italian in the area. We have been here multiple times and Prosecco offers excellent, fresh food, great waitstaff, friendly, hardworking owner and a really polished and clean atmosphere. Excellent calamari, pasta selection, chicken parm, various specials, bread. It's not cheap but it shouldn't be. Give this place a chance as we'd like to see them do well and stay in business.
Love this place! Always perfect! Never anything wrong alway good to the last taste. They make you feel like family evertime you come in! So happy this place is in my neighborhood !

Round One - What a surprise!  This was our first visit to Prosecco.  My Lady and I had gone to the movies next door and afterwards walked down to Prosecco to see what their menu was like.  The decor and configuration of Prosecco invited us in, BRIGHT, COLORFUL, WELL LAYED OUT!.  We decided to have a late lunch/early dinner.  What a great decision.  The menu was impressive to read.  The food was fantastic to eat.  I ordered the Cappelini Pomodoro and my Lady ordered the Enslata Prosecco and we split the meals.  WOW, WOW, WOW!  The Cappelini was spectacular and the salad was fresh and delicious with lots of colors and flavors, just like the decor of Prosecco.  We sinned a bit at the end with a Cannoli for desert and that too was wonderful.  My Lady is 100% Italian and she was so happy with our experience at Prosecco.  We will be back for Round Two in the next week or so.  Hope to have a similar experience.

I was so excited to try out this place that is just a few blocks from my house. Me and my wife were seated promptly and then we waited . . and waited. The restaurant was less than half full so we were a little confused as to why we were being ignored. We waited for a little over 10 minutes and then just had to give up. The food looked good, unfortunately I can't judge the taste . .
Amazing foood .. Service was just one of a kind , this restaurant was at there best! Rohda was amazing

I ate at Prosecco on 3/17/17. My wife had the shrimp pasta special and I had the salmon special. The service was excellent and the meals were sooooooo good that the taste stayed with me after I left the restaurant. Highly recommended

Been there 3 times now. The first two times we had a great experience. The third time the waiter ruined the night. He was short with us. Did not help with the menu and apparently didn't know how to smile or even pretend to be happy. The food was pretty good. I think it's the ruby salad the we really enjoyed. The pasta was great. The 3rd time we shared the ribeye of the menu. It was cooked perfect and seasoned well but the quality of steak was terrible. A step above a steak you would get from a bar when ordering steak and eggs. It was 38 $  they need to take off the menu. Terrible. The first time went I got the 8 oz shrimp special. The shrimp was over cooked.  I'll go back again with hi hopes that they are improving.
Love this restaurant! Went for New Years Eve and ate in the Bar. Tia is the best bartender she makes us so special every time we go! Food was great and the staff is awesome

The service and the atmosphere were excellent. Marco was our server and he was very attentive and had great recommendations about every aspect of our meal. We had a great anniversary dinner!! Will come back for sure!!

If you're looking for incredible, authentic Italian food, you need to check this place out. From the moment you walk in the service is great! The owners come to your table to see how things are going. Now the food, the food is hands down some of the best Italian food I've had in Vegas. They have a great wine selection as well. This is my wife and i go to place.

We dined at Prosecco's last Saturday with another couple and had Rhonda as our server.  She was excellent in describing the specials and answered any questions and helped us decide on our choices.  We neded her advice because the choice of entrees was exceptional!  The pasta is all homemade, the bread was great as were the drinks.  We ordered the filet mignon, a shrimp and pasta dish, lasagna, and the osso buoco.  Fantastic! Food is so fresh and delicious.  We definitely plan on dining here again and will bring our out of town family and friends here when entertaining.  The owner stopped by our table a number of times to make sure our needs were being met, and Rhonda was outstanding as our server.

Customer service is good, our delivery arrived early right at dinner time and our delivery driver didn't mind my crazy dogs at all, but our pizza isn't cooked all the way - it's so doughy & floppy on the inside I can only eat the crust. Salad & Pasta are good so at least we know that for the future! Do not recommend a pizza unless you have time to cook it yourself after it arrives.

The attention to customer service was amazing! We came in 30 minutes before they were to open, but we were happily greeted by the host Nick who introduced us to the head Chef Daniele. Even showed us around a little where their bar and wine room was. We definitely didn't mind coming back in 30 minutes and they did not disappoint! The food is so fresh and delicious! I ordered the spaghetti and meatballs and it is SO good! The meatballs were moist and flavorful and the sauce was like simmered for hours. Waiters were all friendly and checked on us throughout our meal even when it got busy. I will definitely come back and try their desserts. Prosecco is located next to the Regal movie theater on Eastern and Pebble and it has outdoor seating as well. The decor is modern contemporary and it has a vibe of fun without being pretentious. I'm so glad this place has opened here. This will definitely be my new favorite Italian restaurant go-to.

We were looking for a fresh place to have lunch- and found this restaurant on Yelp.  I had the insalada with fresh chicken.  It was a wonderful combination of mango, cucumbers chicken and lettuce with balsamic vinegrette.  We also ordered a canneloni - stuffed with chicken and covered with a bechamel sauce. This is definitely a find for a nice quiet lunch-

Probably the best Italian restaraunt I've ever been to. Literally AMAZING. The owner came up and talked to us a few times, my water was constantly filled, if the waiter didn't know about a specific wine he woukd ask the manager and he personally came to our table to give us additional information about Italian wine. Amazing shrimp & lobster raviolis. I wish I had more!!! 5 stars forsure.
The penne vodka was amazing. We ordered the Chilean seabass and it was amazing as well. The service was excellent. I'm looking forward to going back.

Food was great, service was awesome, and the atmosphere is elegant yet casual at the same time. Loved it here!! Definitely order the calamari appetizer and Lobster ravioli! Food is authentic and tastes amazing.
So pleased this location has reopened. Food, ambience, bar and staff are excellent. The place has a very Italian feel which is a must. I highly recommend this restaurant.

I'm so happy there is a good.wait.. GREAT neighborhood restaurant nearby. My family and I walked in, literately, around 6pm for a quick dinner to this new restaurant we were eyeing.  We were expecting a cafe style restaurant and were pleasantly surprised at the elegant and inviting decor and atmosphere. The waiters were professional and the service overall was great. Now to the food.... AMAZING! Authentic and delicious! We ordered the lentil soup which was the soup of the day, so good! We ordered the heirloom caprese salad, so good! The margerita pizza was yummy, the house bread and oil was delicious. As an entree we had the shrimp paprika - to say it was delicious is an understatement. Each bite was mouthwatering. For dessert we had the gelato and shared it, also delicious. Coffee was good too! 
We went with our four year old daughter and while we felt welcomed to dine as a family, we would likely opt to eat there for an adult night/date night in the future and maybe have a few glasses of wine with our meal. Great place to have dinner with friends or for a date night. Also great if you just want a meal guaranteed to hit the spot. When we arrived it was quiet, however, within minutes the place was full and you could hear laughter and great conversations happening. One of the owners even walked around with a smile on his face greeting everyone. It can't wait to go back again and again.  The prices seemed high when looking at the menu, but the food was quality and it was worth the price. Hard to find places like this that feel authentic and satisfy! I highly recommend this place!
Been here twice, and both times it's been on point!  I definitely recommend this restaurant. Cocktails are great too!

Had.  Lunch today. With my.  2 senior church friends .we had calamari and stuffed pork chops,OMG so delish,we will definitely go back .
Went to church after and we spread the word.
Authentic Italian,owners from Venice and northern Italy.
Very friendly ,excellent service.Classy atmosphere.Loved the Red chandeliers.
Great service, everything is very fresh.  Try the limoncello!  We will definitely be going back.

Went for lunch. First time visit and I will become a regular. Great patio seating as well as indoor seating the atmosphere was excellent . The background music was at a level that allowed for pleasant conversation 
I went with the spinach salad and added the grilled salmon. Salad was fresh and the salmon was perfect!  I was tempted by all the menu items so I will be returning soon and often. I would also rate it as a good value

I live in SE Las Vegas.  My sister and I gave it a try for lunch at 11:30am on Oct 3, 2016.  

SPECTACULAR.

Ambience:  inviting, modern, hip, non-pretentious.  Best use of orange I've ever seen.
Attire:  consider dressing casual with a bit more effort    :-)
Menu:  much enticing variety.
Food quality:  casual gourmet, noticeably fine ingredients.
Food prices:  Very Fair.  Pasta entrée $12.  Big soup $7.  Coke $3.
Presentation:  Artistic, classy.  Probably the best you'll get in zip code 89123.

Service:  MUCH better than most LV restaurants.  Hostess - classy, warm welcome.  Server Juan Carlos gracious, professional, impeccable level of service.  The Chef personally presented our entrees, including a magnificent ravioli truffle special-of-the-day.  Juan Carlos and his assistant kept our drinks full, anticipated our every need, made appropriate menu suggestions.  Thank you for a WONDERFUL spontaneous dining experience.

My sister and I enthusiastically tipped 25% on this lunch.

The owner's attention to detail and quality is so important to him that the restaurant's business cards have his personal cell number on it.  I called owner Giuseppe moments ago to congratulate him on his marvelous dining offering, and he answered the call after two rings!  (He was mixing drinks at the time and was delighted that I called.)  And then he called me back five minutes later to add more information to the answer I was seeking.  How's THAT for entrepreneurial excellence!

I recommend Prosecco Italian cuisine for a bright and cheerful lunch with your sister, for a romantic afternoon or evening dinner date (with someone other than your sister), for a business lunch, or for any well-deserved meal in a casual setting but with first class service above and beyond what we Nevadans usually get at other equally respectable restaurants.

My next visit to Prosecco will be a date night.  I'll catch a 7pm movie next door and then go for a later dinner seating.  Caveat -- although the dining room stays open later, last call to place a dinner order is 10pm.

As of today (Oct 3) their website is not up yet.  But for questions, just call them.  Again, they're very gracious.

A very refreshing lunch or dinner experience.  They're newly opened.  Try it now while you can get a good seat -- it's a matter of time before their reputation makes them the new hot spot in the area.

Thank you for a superb lunch.

Johnny (with Jessica) in Las Vegas

Just ate here tonight.  My goodness the food was amazing.  I got the Veil, it was tender with a delicious pesto cream sauce.  Owner came by to greet us and was wonderful to meet.  This will be in my rotation for great high class Italian food.
Had eaten here last Friday with my fiancé and my in laws and I honestly have to say that their food tasted amazing. Definitely recommend this place and will definitely come back.

I went there for my dad's birthday and the food was phenomenal I also thought the atmosphere was family friendly and casual and the food was 5 stars,the price is very reasonable for the quality of food you receive.

Buyer beware. Food and service OK, however I ordered the "lunch" special assuming price would be the same as some of the pricier menu items $20-$30. When the check showed up with a $50 charge for an OK Osso Bucco , I kicked myself.It was OK but for the same fare I could have gone to Il-Mulino at the strip. 3 star food , 5 star price.

Found this restaurant driving thru the plaza at Eastern/Pebble on a Saturday. Read the reviews and decided to go for Sunday dinner. There were 3 of us for dinner. When we walked in, we were asked if we had a reservation. We did not and didn't think we needed one. The restaurant was less than half full. We were seated and no one came to greet us for at least 10 minutes. Finally "someone" came over and asked if we wanted drinks. I say "someone" because we were never told his name. It took a while to get a coke, iced tea and a water. At this point it started to get busier so we ordered. We had the calamari appetizer. It was good. Our meals included lasagna, eggplant parm & canneloni. Decent sized plates except for the lasagna. It was not thick and was more flat and long.  The taste of the food was decent. Prices were a bit higher than average. 

I paid great attention to the details and the surroundings. As the place filled up, 2 men walked around introducing themselves and spending time with each table full of guests. No one came to our table. We had to ask for refills on the water and eventually the other drinks.  It is a cramped setting. Too many tables inside along the front area. Perhaps the tables (for 2) along the windows shouldn't be there. The guests had trouble getting through the table area and the servers certainly had difficulties as well. We had approximately 1 foot between our table and the one next to us - I felt like I was on their date with them. 

Plenty of wait staff, but seemed to be still learning since they weren't very attentive.

I am chef in San Francisco so I know what I sayLast night was my worst dinner ever!!! everything was  disgusting the pasta fettuccine toco no taste,lamb chop was over cook my god this place is fuck up I wanna meet the chef !! For tell him you are Sirius   I come back soon I want free dinner  for my family " Prosecco  " sucks !!!!!!!

We had a great first experience at Prosecco! Claudio was an awesome server. I loved that so many people actually speak Italian here.  Our food was delicious and the wine was superb! I had the saltimboca and my mom had chicken scalopine limone. We cleaned our plates. My daughter was treated like a princess (she was dressed like Belle lol) and she said this was her new favorite pizza! And they gave her gelato as dessert. So kind, great service, delicious food. Highly recommended!
Love it! Upscale Italian eatery. We had a lobster pasta, osso bucco dish and bruschetta appetizer. Loved all of it. Delicious. Great service. Nice wine selection. Pleasant ambiance

Last night my wife and I ate, for the first time, at Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen.  We each had a different recommended special.  My wife had a pasta dish with shrimp and one of the shrimp was the size of a small lobster!!  I had a veal/prosciutto/cheese dish with a fantastic arugula and cherry heirloom tomatoes.  We each had a glass of Chianti which was also outstanding.
We agreed that this was the best meal we have had in months.  We spent time speaking to Giuseppe who greeted us warmly when we entered, made recommendations for dinner and checked on us several times throughout the amazing dinner.  The dinner was definitely the best meal we have had in any restaurant in months and we HIGHLY recommend it.
If Yelp had a 6 star rating I would rate this restaurant, the food and the staff as a solid 6+. 
We will go back!!

Our first visit here and we will be back!  Daniel, Nico, Carlo are fabulous. The cuisine is authentic and so flavorful. Your hunt is over - Prosecco is a wonderful venue and welcoming to our selections. 
Ciao a tutti!  Fantastico!

Awesome addition to the Henderson / Eastern Ave restaurant scene. My girlfriend and I live just right down the road from here and we have been waiting forever for this gem to open. We went on a Thursday night and had such a great experience there, the chef absolutely knows what he is doing and the front of house staff are very knowledgeable. If you are looking for authentic Italian food then this is the spot, we started our meal off with a Caesar salad and calamari. The calamari was excellent, great breading which was very light and seasoned just right. My girlfriend is a huge Caesar fan and gets this salad almost everywhere we go, she said this was one of the best dressings and I totally agree with her. For our entree's I had the Ribeye medium rare, the steak was cooked to perfection and was much better than any other strip steakhouses in my opinion, just salt and pepper seasoned so you are actually tasting the great quality of the beef. My girlfriend had the Linguine Mediterania under dry pasta's, they sure do not short you on seafood with this dish. Her scallops in the pasta could not of been cooked any better, they were like butter! Nico one of the owners was a very nice gentleman who made sure he stopped by every table to ask how things were and to tell a little bit about the restaurant which was very nice. Overall this was a great experience and we will most definitely come back. Next time I am going to try the pizza from their woodfire oven! Great Job Prosecco!

Great Italian restaurant for those who live around the area! Highly recommend!

FOOD: Everything on the menu is made fresh. The chef is there every day and comes up with delicious daily specials. The pasta dishes I recommend are their raviolis and their pasta in the cheese wheel. The cheese ravioli is my favorite dish here because the sauce is made to perfection. The cheese wheel is not only a delicious dish, but is also comes with a table-side presentation where they mix the pasta in front of you.

DRINKS: They have an interest bar with a wide wine and cocktail selection. I highly recommend the Southside, it is my favorite drink here. The bartender is really great at making the drinks to you liking and will fix any drink if it doesn't come out how you want it.

SERVICE: The waiters here are very friendly. I am most shocked that they are very knowledgeable about the dishes. The waiters are able to tell you how the dishes are prepared, what dishes would be best for your liking, and they are even able to bring out the dishes and serve them properly. I had a fish dish and the waiter deboned the fish as well as split the serving without the customer having to ask. The manager and chef even came out to my table to introduce themselves and make sure everything tasted good.

ATMOSPHERE: The restaurant is beautiful. They bring out candles, bring up the blinds when the sun is setting, and have a gentleman playing the guitar and singing to set the mood for the restaurant.

We just tried this place through yelp24 because we saw that they delivered and we couldn't be happier! This will definitely be our new go to delivery food but now I'm anxious to go dine in as well. Coming from a super authentic Italian family of chefs, I'm really critical of Italian food but this place was one of the better Italian restaurants I've had in the valley. We tried the spinach salad, minestrone, and tiramisu and it was all perfect. They even included a little bundle of bread and dip, which was a great touch! Highly recommend this place.

We just finished dinner there no less than 20 minutes ago and to be honest we were very disappointed. We were dining with our my mother in law who was turning 69 today and we explained as such to the beautiful hostess.  But there was mention throughout the evening by any staff member of the special occasion, nor at dessert which is fairly commonplace.

 To further add insult to injury, we arrived for an 8pm reservation  of 4 at 7:56 but weren't seated until 8:19.  I get that there are some uncontrollable aspects with multiple other parties not clearing their table as expected, but no offset was ever offered.  No compliementary cocktail, no appetizer compliementary of the chef, no apology whatsoever.

Overall the food was very mediocre at best. The bread was delicious and the large portion of herbal dipping oil appeared fantastic, but the reality is the oil was it was seriously lacking any seasoning and tasted more like grass/herbs than a typical higher-end dipping oil for the price points in this restaurant.  We ordered the special octopus, which was a huge portion but terribly under seasoned and nothing compared to the top octopus in the city at Milos at Cosmopolitan.  It was effectively chargrilled with no seasoning at all.  It was she first time I have ever had to salt octopus.  We ordered the sausage entree which was fairly spicy and fringe undercooked which hopefully does not come back to haunt us tonight.   We ordered two pasta dishes of which one was a B and the other C-.  Both were heavy on the pasta and light on the ancillary components that sold the dish: the meat, cheese, and veggies.  Finally we had the "people's favorite" pizza with artichoke and prosciutto which was okay.  It was a white pizza which the menu didn't describe, but the waitress happily brought a huge portion of marinara when requested to supplement.  

Overall we were just sorely disappointed as first time guests for an avg check of $26 per person before alcohol.  With so many delicious Italian options on Eastern, I don't see any of us ever coming back to Prosecco.
My family came here before my daughter's college graduation. Beautiful atmosphere. Delicious and fresh food. My family will definitely will be be back.

A friend from work recommended this resteraunt so we thought we would give it a try...and I am so glad we did!!
We had the ravioli with squash, and the spaghetti and meatballs.  Both were delicious, exceeding our expectations.  We will defiantely be returning, and sharing our new find with others!!

Great decor and attentive staff.  Owner/host Nicco, was very pleased to talk food and business  (only been open 6 wks.) It was refreshing.
We had a small issue with waiting for one of our plates to come out, hence the 4 stars.  But the owner asked if he could provide dessert for the trouble.  We were in a bit of a rush so he instead removed the item from our bill, classy guy! Kept it from being 3 stars... food took a while to come out.
I was convinced to try the Osso Buco, an off the menu item, holy crap was that good! Also $45, which wasn't mentioned before hand... oh well, was falling off the bone tender, very delicious, and huge, I will throw a picture up.
Nice place not busy yet, so comfortable atmosphere, I would come back for sure.

Chef Giuseppe knows us, we are regulars. He suggested two meals that were simply amazing! My husband had Sole served table-side by Giuseppe and I had lobster on fresh pasta of the day. The salad course he suggested was the roasted red and yellow beet salad on fresh greens with goat cheese and candied walnuts. Layered full flavors, paired expertly, for a wonderful experience. I noticed he greeted each guest and escorted them to their table. It was thrilling to see someone with such passion for what he does, taking personal care of customers.

Hidden gem. Never heard of this place, but it was cute and the food was great! 

We arrived early and it was quiet. By 630 the place was packed. They had a live musician as well. Cute patio for when it cools down. 

They promote a happy hour but it's only for the bar. 

Do not, I repeat, do not, order any of the specials. You'll literally fall off your chair with sticker shock when the bill arrives. My "special" was 3.5x the price of my fellow diners! (It was tasty, but not 3.5x tastier...ya feel me?) Not only that, but it was an entire dish more expensive than the highest priced item on the menu. Not feeling so special anymore. 

Overall, worth trying if you're nearby. Stick to the menu.

Simply amazing!! Everything about this restaurant is amazing! Great ambiance, friendly servers, music, and food! We loved the flavors of each dish. Finally an authentic Italian food on our side of town. We will definitely be back!!

One of my new favorite, if not most favorite, restaurants ever! I have never been more impressed flavor wise. My husband and I love this place. This. Place is a MUST try- you will not be disappointed!!

Love the family atmosphere of this neighborhood gem! Vast menu, different specials daily. Excellent service. On my last visit I wasn't sure what to order, the owner came by our table and gave me options that neither were on the menu nor on the daily's special. The extra mile for service makes a customer feel heard and appreciated. The food is terrific. Amazing cheese board,  great steaks, fresh tasting pasta sauce. I would not only be back as I will recommend to others.
Had a spectacular lunch outdoors--the hand made ravioli and osso bucco was delicious And perfectly prepared! Can't wait to go again.
The food was excellent. A bit pricey, but you get what you pay for I guess. I had the serf and turf.

I have been noticing that the previous Italian restaurant was replaced while riding by on my bike. I was sure this would be an improvement. It was in many ways. The décor is a fresh, clean and bright feeling, much more up to date than the old red and white, typically dark Italian restaurant. The food tasted very good. My husband had Caprese which was a step above the norm. I had the quinoa and hazelnut salad which was very nicely underdressed and had good flavor. The dipping oil for the bread did not have the taste of the herbs in it, and might have been better with some garlic or balsamic in it. The bread itself was very good. My husband had linguine with clams and loved it. I had a ravioli with gorgonzola and asparagus creamy sauce. The flavors in mine could have been more pronounced and the homemade pasta was undercooked. For dessert we shared a custard with strawberry coulis. It was not too sweet and a nice way to finish off with something light. 
The service could have been friendlier, such as giving us their name and pointing out the special and fundraiser. Also, the I initial contact and bread were slow in coming. Water filling was prompt. Food service was prompt. Service overall had a hesitant feel, so perhaps this can be attributed to their being open only one week. One if the owners came and spoke to us, which was very nice. 
We felt the prices were high, so we cannot go often, but we will return

Not impressed with the food or the service. 
I had the Linguine Mediterranea and, for $27, I expected a better dish. There wasn't much flavor at all. My husband also disliked the Ravioli d' Aragosta. 
Our waiter was very inattentive. We could tell he didn't appreciate the fact we weren't having cocktails or wine. My husband waited for a soda refill for quite a while. I ordered dessert from the waiter, he repeated my order back to me, but came right back with the check - he didn't even put the dessert in. We paid and left, sure we won't be back here.
Great food great service . Will come back again give it a try .  The best Italian food I've had in this town
I ordered the Spaghetti Vongole to go. It was a bit greasy. For the price I paid I would expect a bit more. I might come back and try them out again.
Very nice place - went for lunch.  Italian music was playing and my husband and I had a pleasant meal with great service.

If you are wanting some great wine and an Italian meal, look no further! The fantastic food was equaled with the quick and courteous wait staff. The crab/lobster stuffed ravioli with shrimp atop was soooo damn good!  WOW   Save some room for their great desserts. Prosecco is perfection!

Great food and decor, hidden gem thank you yelp for helping me find it! Only thing I would change is the music. It didn't seem to go with the Italian theme and was not relaxing. Food was amazing We split  a pizza and beet and goat cheese salad with shrimp which had amazing spices on them and we were definitely full
The Nutella. Crepes with bananas were amazing 
Wonderful wine selection

Amazing service! Legit best Italian spot in Vegas and you don't even need to mess with a strip hotel. Had the Ruby salad and Lobster Tail, both excellent.  Place was slammed but one of the owners took the time to come over and check that everything was cool. Will be coming back for sure.

First time here. Great atmosphere BUT...had to wait forever to get everything!!!! Wasn't crowded for a friday night and the restaurant wasn't that big for such a long wait time. Food was decent but staff neefs to step it up. Might give one more try...

Solid solid food. Great bread and salads which is key to getting things started. The salmon was seasoned and cooked perfectly. Definitely going to be making the trip back in the future when I'm in town!
Best eggplant parm on the planet...so much so that I  pay $30 on Doordash to have it delivered. Omg. Delish
The best salmon I have ever had. Cooked perfectly. The Salmon over fennel was absolutely wonderful!  Beautiful sauce, wonderful taste!

Fantastic as always! Being that it was Mother's Day, we didn't realize they were only serving a specific menu for brunch. We come here quite often and love the spaghetti. So we asked if there was a way to get spaghetti and they accommodated us! I Couldn't have asked for a better experience! I highly recommend this place. The food is incredible. Thank you Chef for making my mothers day! Nicco was so helpful and our waitress Rhonda was great!!! Highly recommended!!

Really want to like this place; but can't.  First visit was good enough to get us to return; but service was spotty and mashed potatoes were cold.  The menu is good and the ambiance is nice.  Second visit was worse.  We made a reservation and when we arrived we were told the only available table for us was outside...which we really didn't want.  They should have asked when the reservation was made.  It took forever to place our drink order and even longer to get the drinks.  The entrees were delivered at different times and mine was cold and had to be sent back.  Another in our party got cold food as well; but didn't send it back.  Probably because it took 5 minutes to get someones attention to get the food back to the kitchen.  Not a lot of flavor in the dishes combined with poor service and cold food....not going back.  Sorry, wanted a new favorite place but this isn't it.

Outstanding! Quintessential, "If you build it they will come !" story!!
Pesto black olive tapenade 
Mango, avocado, tomato, cucumber salad  
Caprese salad
Pepperoni pizza
Salmon tagliatelle 
Veal piccata  
Four cheese agnolotti 
Tiramisu

This place was such an amazing find!!  We were more than pleased with everything!!  They seated us right away.  Waiters were prompt.  The food...  OMG so delicious!!!  From our salad (insalata Prosecco) to our main course was AH-MA-ZING!!!  Loved that the owner & chef came out to ask us how we enjoyed their food We will definitely visit again when we're back in town!

I think I have bad luck when it comes to Italian dining.  Prosecco fits the bill.  

Looking forward to a nice dinner with friends, we were all anxious to experience a new place.  An experience it was.  The service wasn't quite what I expected.  We didn't have a definitive waiter.  Many gentlemen stopped at our table during the evening.  It was unsettling when we had to repeat our order at the end of the evening because he didn't know who ordered which entree.  It was also unsettling when I ask one waiter if they offer Moscato and he says yes.  A different gentlemen comes back with Riesling telling me it's the same and they don't have Moscato.  I reluctantly took the Riesling but the magic act was unnecessary.  

For my meal I started with the Caesar Salad.  It was a very large portion I which I could share with my husband.  Great flavor with freshly shaved Parmesan was delicious.  

I also opted for the Stuffed Salmon.  Well, you could probably just name it salmon because there was very very little crab stuffing.  The fish was also over cooked. It was not a dish I would recommend.  

With a competitive restaurant town, I would've hoped for a better presentation.  A three hour overpriced meal left me underwhelmed.

This place opened about a year ago and I've been meaning to give it a try! Finally did last night, it was amazing! Our server, Ronda, was awesome! Helpful, friendly and definitely made sure we were taken care of promptly! We ordered the pasta wheel, it was fun to watch and tasted pretty good! The shrimp was over cooked and rubbery. Without even asking Ronda knew by the look on our faces. She immediately made it right! Will return, often!

Decided to give this new restaurant a try and was not disappointed.  The portions are not huge,but large enough to fill you up. The menu selection and specials give you a wide array of Italian dishes.  The wait staff was very attentive. Giuseppe and Nico the owners are present and actively involved. The decor is simple and modern the open kitchen concept is really nice. The live music was a bit too loud but very good. Everyone that went in our party had different main courses and enjoyed them.  The desserts were amazing

Honestly, I don't like giving out poor reviews on places. I usually only give 5 stars and if I feel it was less than that I won't write a review but this was unacceptable. My cousin and I went in tonight for dinner after a really long day of work for me and I wanted to enjoy my birthday dinner. We got there at 915pm and they close at 10. I knew it was kind of late but I thought it looked like a nice place to enjoy ourselves. I expected a lot better service being that I do work in the service industry. We waited for our water more than 10 minutes and there were only 2 other tables still in the restaurant. So being that it was slow I felt like I could've gotten serviced faster. As I sat down at the table, I could see into their kitchen area where I saw multiple employees just standing and talking while we waited for WATER! We almost got up and left but we were hungry and decided to stay. As we sat there we saw the 2 tables next to us get treated way better than us and actually serviced. We then decided to have our food to go because we felt rushed and unwanted there. The server didn't even tell us his name probably because he didn't care to give us the quality we deserved.  It's sad that we experienced this type of service because the food was delicious. Since the food was good but the service was poor this is not a place I would come back to or even tell a friend to try. Management should really talk to their employees and remind them that this is a customer service/hospitality based job and they should never make their guests feel unwanted or like a burden.

Honestly - I love the servers, the food is delish, however; the owner or manager stands back and chooses who or which table to address rather than check in on everyone.  I find that a bit preferential.  It makes a person feel as if they do NOT matter.   There is so much more to owning a dining place than ensuring the food is prepared properly -  because that attitude can ruin the entire experience and it did!!!!

Great spot for good Italian. We sat in the bar with the bartender, Nicole. She was a sweetheart and made great wine and entree recommendations. The Burratina appetizer is delicious. So are the pizzas. We had the Bianca - so yummy.  Great spot for neighborhood Italian.

Came to check out this new Italian restaurant in Henderson. First of all, the owners are present and friendly. When you first walk in, Nico is here with open arms and eager to show the beautiful restaurant off. 

The decor is modern and bright. There is an open kitchen where you can see the cooks make fresh pasta and cook in the wood fired oven.

We had an appetizer of crostini with fresh tomatoes and ricotta served with cured meats. All the entree were cooked perfectly, my eggplant melted in my mouth. My roommate had the Cioppino and I got to taste some and it was fantastic.

They also have a happy hour that I glimpsed at the menu of and I'm definitely coming back for a $7 pizza and a $9 waygu burger! 

This place will be a local gem. I can't wait to see how it grows!

We went to Prosecco on Friday night for dinner.  Having heard what a great restaurant it was we were eager to try it.  Friends had told us the food was great, the service was great and what a great host the owner was.  We were excited.  True the food was good, the service was good.  Our waiter Joaquin was terrific.  However, the owner, Guiseppe, was a great disappointment.  As we sat there I watched him go to every single table, sometimes twice, spoke to the guests and even sat down at some of the tables to talk and ask how everything was.  We sat there for a good 90 minutes and never once did he come to our table to see how the food or the service was.  He did visit the table next to us twice.   Our bill was over $100 so it wasn't as though we were just there taking up space and not ordering.  I was insulted.  My husband stopped to talk to him as we were leaving and told him that the food was great but that we had noticed he did not stop at our table and he had gone to all the others, he lied and said he "was putting out fires."  We had watched him for over an hour as he visited each table.  We paid and left.  Never to go back again.   You only get one chance to make a first impression!

Loved the food is delicious. The reason I only gave 3 stars was because of the service. Our server was pretty rude and acted like he didn't want to be there. He took our drink orders and I said I wanted a drink menu, he kinda made a face and never brought me one. Needless to say I never did get to order from the bar.

A hidden gem.   The decor is modern yet classy, the patio is large and tasteful, and the food is fantastic.   We had the beet and goat cheese salad, meatballs, pasta, fish, desert, wine, and more, and everything was top notch.  And it's not that far from the strip.  And it's reasonably priced.   Highly recommend the detour.
This has had to be one of the best Italian meals I have had. Service outstanding. Moderate priced. Food was very fresh. Pasta made here daily. We will definitely be back!

I was hesitant at first thinking this might not be the best place for Italian - but I was pleasantly surprised. Great bread, large portions and great food. Service was a little lacking but it was due to lack of servers and not bad service per se.

Ordered Caprese salad at $13.00 and chicken parm for $24.00 delivered. Both were very small portions and boring flavors. For $40 per person I expected to be dazzled. Very disappointed and will not recommend this place to anyone.

I've been here for dinner a bunch of times and each time have been incredibly impressed with both the quality of food and the service. Today we were looking for a place to go for Sunday brunch. Several breakfast/lunch only places have opened in the area. While most of them are OK, none really distinguish themselves. It was a beautiful Autumnal morning, soI thought I would try Proseco because they have an nice outdoor patio area that is nicely separated from the parking lot. Made a reservation which they honored. To our very pleasant surprise, they had an outstanding jazz sax player on the patio. Really nice touch!!! The brunch menu has a good assortment of omelets and other standard brunch items as well as a couple of more traditional Italian offerings. I went with the Ocean View omelet. Loaded with shrimp, avocado, feta cheese, and some lobster. Yummm! Best brunch experience I have had in a very long time. I will be back.
This place is fantastic. The service was so good and your glass is never empty. The food was amazing. The employees were so friendly. You have to try this place.

We went to Prosecco Saturday night and sorry to say I was not impressed. The service was fine and the atmosphere was pleasant. However the food was just ok. I ordered the Mediterranean seafood and the lobster portion was basically empty. The sauce is not so Italian to me, it was a bit weak. I probably won't go there again. So sorry.

We were in the mood for Italian and decided to try a place we haven't been. Went at 4pm in a Friday and there was no one there, we were the only ones! There is seating indoor and out. It would be nice to sit outside in the fall/spring when the weather is nice. 

Dinner begins at 3pm so we didn't qualify to order off the lunch menu. First bread was brought out. It was so crusty on the outside and soft on the inside, so good! The ravioli with the truffle sauce was the best, chunks of truffle in every bite. If you love truffle, this dish is for you. The scampi paprika had some very large shrimp and was also a great dish! 

The kids pizza and fries is quite large, I wouldn't recommend it unless you have 2-4 kids to share it. The fries come on top of the pizza. It's a wood fired pizza and very thin crust. 

For dessert we had the chocolate gelato. Also, large portion. But so delicious, tasted just like the gelato in Rome. The espresso was perfectly made as well. 

The service was great. The restaurant is truly authentic Italian from what we experienced.

This is the best Pizza I ever eat ! I am European and believe me I know the Italian kitchen! Bravo ! Bravo ! Bravo!
Will recommend to all my friends and family 
Petko

We like the restaurant and have been a regular with take outs for lunch and dinner, BUT my problem with the place is its inconsistency! At times, we picked up portions that are too salty, overdone pasta, and portion sizes.

Last night was the among the worst. The pastas included in the portions (spaghetti and tocco) were HALF the size of the other times.

We will still like the restaurant and will go back, but please work with the back kitchen staff on maintaining quality and consistency. Hopefully it will be better next time.

My wife and I loved the food, but they sit you so close to the party next to you if you are a party of two you may as well eat off their plate.  Their is absolutely no privacy.

Based on the seating only, we will not return.

We stopped in for dinner. Service was outstanding! Food was a little disappointing as well as being overpriced. 
Probably won't go back.
Very fresh ! fast and very pleasant service.. the hostess was very helpful, environment was nice and live music was
I was given a ridiculously small portion of pasta when I ordered from this place through Eat24. I would say to anyone thinking of ordering here find someplace else.

The owner is very nice, the food is excellent and they took care of a delivery problem with EAT24 immediately. He called me directly which I appreciate. We also go here for lunch and the staff is very professional and friendly.
We've been living in Vegas for 3 years and i thunk we've finally found an authentic Italian flavor and atmosphere.

I'm fairly new to Vegas and was in the mood for Italian. Working at a fantastic fine dinning Italian place for years I find myself somewhat picky. To my supreme satisfaction Prosecco far exceeded my expectations. I had the Lobster and my girlfriend had the chicken parm. I cant say enough about the sauce and the hand rolled pasta but it was excellent. Marco was are server and really made us feel welcomed and at home. Finally if you do have a chance to make it out you need to have the tiramisu for dessert, it will change your life.

Our second time here, but we ended up leaving before being seated. We made a reservation but they wanted to seat us at the bar - I don't understand why restaurants do this. Reservations are intended for dining room seating. There were other open tables but the hostess said they were reserved for other reservations. She made it sound like we were walk in customers or that our reservation was less important than the others. The hostess kept claiming they were fully booked, but they were still taking reservations on the Open Table app!

The first time we were here, the food was excellent, but service was extremely slow. It took over 2 hours and we are fast diners. After this attempted visit, it seems they need to improve service all around.

Disappointing because we live 20 minutes away and drove all the way here, only to leave and go somewhere else.

Fantastic! Fantastic! Fantastic! The food is great authentic Italian cuisine, atmosphere is very classy (with live jazz music), and the service was amazing! The lasagna made me speechless and everyone in my party was blown alway by the food. The manager Niko was extremely nice and our server our Mario was funny and so personable. They were really down to earth. I took my mother and her friend from Michigan and everyone was more than pleased. Great place!

I've tried this restaurant twice now, and the first time it was decent, but the 2nd time around I'm not so impressed.
The location is nice, with pleasant décor and outdoor seating.  The tables and chairs outside are a bit cheap in quality, as they are wrapped in a plastic wicker cover, and they've decided to place an untethered seat cushion on each seat.  This arrangements is a bit frustrating on two levels, the seat cushions easily slide off and/or move so you have to be annoyingly cognizant of what you're sitting on, and, the plastic wicker table obviously has holes in it, so be careful not to spill anything as it will drip through and on to your pants/skirt/legs. 
The Staff was courteous and friendly each visit and pleasantly accommodating.
The reason I gave the review two stars is for both quality of the food and for lack of concern when the problem was pointed out. 
We ordered the mixed cold cuts and cheese appetizer for two, which I would have expected generous portions provided since the appetizer was $30.
Instead we got paper thin 4 slices of Mortadella (Italian bologna), 5-6 small slices of Prosciutto, and 4 slices of salami (ea. paper thin and the size of 50 cent piece).  There were 4 small cubes of cheese (unknown kind because the waiter didn't bother explaining what's on the plate), a dollop some marinated green peppers, a dollop of some marinated mushrooms, one small artichoke cut in half, and 5-6 Kalamata olives.  There's no way you convince me that was a $30 appetizer. I've had much better at other restaurants for half the price. (So I would recommend avoiding that at all costs)
The quality problem was actually with that very same appetizer.  Parts of the Mortadella were dried out and had the consistency of a potato chip.  There's only one way that could happen, and that is the meat had been previously sliced and not stored properly, as the meat dried out and hardened. 
When I pointed this problem out to the waiter, he said he would let the chef know about it. 
Sadly, 10 minutes later the waiter came back as though nothing had transpired, and asked "So, how was the appetizer?"  
Needless to say, neither the waiter, the chef, or management ever came by to address the problem with the meat.  I guess I was just expected to eat it and pay for it, regardless of how it was mishandled.
The other issue I had with the dinner that evening was the timing.  After we got the appetizer, it literally took 35 minutes for the entrée (pasta dishes) to arrive. So about 10 minutes to get through the appetizer and 25 minutes of waiting for the next plate.
At the end of the dinner, as we were leaving, the waiter checked with us and said "I hope everything was good" and I replied "everything except for the appetizer" and his response was "Yea, sorry about that."   Well, I'm sorry too, but my sorry is that I'm not going to be spending any more money there anytime soon.
Overall, nice place, but needs some significant fine tuning.

I stopped by after a hard workout and the Sunday brunch was so worth the treat! I the tagliatelle salmone had so much flavor and wasn't so big that you couldn't finish it. I also really enjoyed the mini souffle that was a special dish for the day! The atmosphere was pretty and light. I can't wait to come back.

Amazing !!! The pizza was amazing - that the kids had. We had the chicken parm and the ceaser salad - both where amazing !!! The portions were big! The sauce on the spaghetti and parmigiana was amazing . Very cheesy and delicious . We will be back for sure!

Nothing was wrong here - in a sea of great Italian options in Vegas though, it just seemed a bit mediocre for me. Service was fine, not exceptional. I think we had a pasta dish and a pizza, and neither stood out. The decor was trying to be trendy and hip, but it wasn't quite there. If this was in a small town I'm sure it'd be the top Italian place, but there's a half dozen Italian places I'd go to in Vegas before returning here, I think.

Definitely a cut above the standard Italian fare around here. Great service. Real artistry in the food prep and presentation. Very nice bruschetta appetizer, and a terrific beet salad; maybe the best I've ever had, and I'm a big fan of that type of salad. Wife had lasagna, which was excellent. I had the fettuccine with braised short ribs; total standout. Good sized servings; we each brought half of our order home.

Wife had strawberry crepe for dessert. I had the cannoli. Both very good. Left full and very satisfied. Will return.
Thrilled! Delicious Meal, hip beautiful space. Rhonda for the win!
New, modern, great Italian menu. If you're in the mood for great food and ambiance this is your place.

God! Italian food should be a sin -- for it is the most tempting savory in the world! Speaking of the taste: this restaurant has it. Prosecco knows what I like before I order it. I took my friends to dinner to celebrate my promotion, and we all wanted to go to a place where we can get overly-happy and make some noise. Well, we ordered the out-of-this-world tasty food and had our cocktails and wine and got loud and happy (thank you, friends!)...and then the Food came...and we all got so quiet....We all looked like predators over our plates. I ordered the Organica salad & the Scaloppine dish...and I surrendered to the exceptional taste. My fiancee ordered the Italian fillet mignon...Filetto di or al Manzo...and we waltzed in pleasure. I let my friends pick the wine...and, boy, mamma mia, what a finesse! Clink! An extra 3 miles of running next day was worth it for the scrumptious desert: Raspberry ...Bavarese al Fragole..! I truly, friendly recommend this awesome Italian restaurant. Take your significant other or others (LOL) and have an authentic Italian cuisine experience. Loved it! (it matched the quality of my promotion, haha! Vedi Prosecco e puoi ...mangia, mangia! Long live Italy!
Have been here twice now, and had wonderful experiences both times. Great service, great food. Highly recommend this great neighborhood restaurant.

True Sicilian southern Italian cuisine.  Excellent food, fantastic service. There is a classy bar serving the full menu as well. I make sure to stop by the bar when Teya is working for very good service and conversation. Perfect "off the strip" location in Henderson to bring a date.

We were anxiously awaiting this restaurant to open where Gabriellas used to be. 

The food-4 out of 5 stars. The owner is from Sicily and the chef is from Venice. So I guess we can call it Italian fusion if fusion can be used as a replacement for over priced. Sauces are very good but for what you get it is not worth the price. The over priced food can possibly be the downfall of this place because I do not see many return visits for that reason.

Service-3 out of 5 stars. Our waiter was eager to please but had zero knowledge of what was available from the bar and I had to get up and walk to the bar to see what beers were available on tap.

Ambience-1 or 2 out of 5. Far from a quiet or possibly romantic place for a quiet dinner. High ceilings and kind of loud.
I normally like and get a good feeling when the owner is present,this place the exception. The owner Nico interrupted our dinner conversation twice and he comes off as a bit of an arrogant prick in skinny jeans. When he talks to you it feels like he is talking down to you and I don't think the employees respect him but they are certainly afraid of him which makes for a very uptight feeling amongst the staff. I think he would be better served staying in the kitchen and keeping things running smoothly from there and find a nicer restaurant rep for out front. 
We will return but not often because of the prices.

I love Italian food and I go to a few places in town that serves authentic Italian food.  A good Italian friend, Morati invited us to try this new restaurant, Prosecco. Oh my gosh, this place is amazing!!  We had their mouthwatering pork belly, calamari and bruschetta for appetizer.  Then for the entree, I had the black pasta with squid.   It is as good if not better than what I had  in Italy! Chef Daniel Dotto and his business partner, Pino, came to introduce themselves.   Great atmosphere, friendly staff, and exquisite food !   Best Italian food in town!!!!

My boyfriend and I were craving Italian food and saw that this restaurant had just opened. The atmosphere is nice and romantic. Very clean and the hostess and servers were friendly! The food is exactly what we wanted and expected and was brought out in reasonable time. I had the meatballs and my boyfriend had shrimp linguini, and we had no complaints.

We used to come here when it was "Gabriella's", this is better!

The ladies bathroom has baby wipes! So convenient. They also have sugar hand scrub that you can use after you wash your hands with their soap so that you can exfoliate! Such a clean place. The good is so fresh you can see the chef cook your food right in front of you!
Outstanding service and real Italian food! Very pleased with my experience. Definitely going back!

Pizza and eggplant parm was amazing. Pasta and cheese are fresh. Everything cooked to perfection. Will definitely go back. The only reason not 5 stars is service can be slow when you're trying to leave And the music doesn't match the ambience at all.
Great food and great service. Authentic Italian cuisine. Only complaint I have is the pricing for the amount of food. I will for sure return when I don't have 4 kids to pay for.
Really good food and service! This is a noisy place for dinner but not so much you can't have a conversation at a 4-top table.  Nice place in Henderson for dinner.

After having been delighted at Nora's we decided to try Prosecco. Overall good food, couple areas of fine tuning

Ambiance
Mod/European interior with a mix of industrial exposed ceilings and fancier touches like crystal chandeliers and modular art. A mixture of tables, semi-private booths, and more private booths.  Feels expansive and open yet intimate and warm.  

Service
We were seated quickly and then waited some time for service although servers came to check on us.  Most likely a factor of needing to fine tune team work. One of the owners (the same one who'd seated us) passed by and asked if anyone had helped us and took our drink orders. Later someone else (I think the other owners) told us about the specials. We then placed our orders.  The appetizer came quickly, but the food took a little longer. The guests at the next table looked over at us and asked if we had our food yet as they hadn't received theirs either. I am guessing that there may have been a miscommunication in the kitchen.  We received our food shortly after.  The owners made multiple attempts to turn the evening around as they sensed there was disappointment among the guests regarding bringing out the food.  He offered us free prosecco on the house and a free crème brulee.   I believe that intentions of the owners was for us to have a superb experience and I truly appreciate that.  All of the evening could have been smoother with just more communication among staff.  Sometimes it is not about being "perfect" with regards to businesses, rather to do anything to show that you appreciate the business of your patrons.  Having been a part of opening a restaurant before, I know there are small kinks here and there.  This place has a good start and plenty of potential.

Food
1) Cocktails: Well flavored and balanced.  Spritzletini was one of the drinks and I loved the presentation and flavors.  Nice combination of fruity and aromatic.  
2) Appetizer Bruschetta: nice balance of fresh-fresh tomatoes and herbs.  Crusty Bread.  Also the bread basket with tapenade was amazing!!!  They refilled it for us without asking and I'm glad they did!
3) Caesar Salad: nice of the staff to split it into two bowls, going that extra mile.
4) Shrimp and Lemon chicken entrées: Shrimp was jumbo and plump, juicy and sweet.  Sauce tasted really good.  Medium sized helping of pasta.  Sauce slightly on the saltier side, roll out those margaritas....oh....wrong place :)  Lemon chicken hearty with lots of vegetables.  
5) Crème Brulee: on the house - beautiful rustic chic presentation with meringue cookie.  Nice touch!

Mojo
1) Go for the ambiance, a nice place to spend the evening and catch up with friends (new and old).  Take a leisurely time and have dinner like they do in Europe: a night of conversation and finishing with cappuccino...and/or fruit/chocolates.
2) Get the cocktails, ask for the dessert menu.

The food wasn't bad, but I don't think it was worth the price. I wouldn't choose to come again unless a friend of family was in town and they wanted something close since I live nearby.

The servers were very friendly, but they interrupted us way too many times. There is a fine line between being attentive and being intrusive, and I felt they went a little overboard with the service. Asking me way too many times if I was still working on my dish.

Atmosphere was great. Such a beautiful restaurant! Food was pretty terrible. For sure the worst Italian I have ever had. I felt the prices were high so they can try to make the money back that they spent on renovations . When I was asked if I wanted a glass of wine I really felt that the waiter wanted me to spend more money , he didn't genuinely want me to have wine. Maybe I only felt this way because I was the ONLY person in the restaurant so there was awkward silence. Will not return. If this place stays open for 8 more mothers I will be shocked.

Worst Customer service ever.......
Food was nothing to write home about. Wobbly tables, tried moving tables, waiter flipped out  & turned into douchbag cause restaurant was empty. Took forever to receive order in a empty restaurant. Busboy was nice, but we won't be back.........

Bye Felicia

Delicious authentic Italian food . The place is very cute modern and elegant . The staff is great I always seat at the bar and the bartenders are very friendly and make your experience the best . My favorite spot if I'm craving Italian food :)

Highly recommended this place.  Food,  service,  drinks,  staff - all top notch.  Hidden away in a corner I found this place on yelp.  Thankfully they had room at the bar and I treated my friend to one absolutely fantastic meal.

Hands down this was one of the best experiences. Took my girlfriend and her mother here (had to make a good impression).First, we were greeted by the hostess and the owner right away. Was seated in front of the kitchen so we could our food being prepped and all the handmade pasta being created. Already amazing. The server was very friendly and prompt. Introduced himself, memorized all the specials, and made some great recommendations. After snacking on the homemade bread or food was ready in an instant. You can taste the love that was put into the food like it was your own mother! Every bite was better than the last. While enjoying, the owner stopped by to check on us and made sure everything was going well. To end the night, we had Crema Bruciata (highly recommended) and Limoncello to finish it off. Everything was very reasonably priced for what you are getting. On our way out the owner thanked us for our business and hoped to see us again. Well my friend, you will. 

If you are looking for a great Italian kitchen, look no further. This place is relatively new, but seems like they've been doing this for years. A+ service, food, and atmosphere!

We arrived at 11 AM on a Saturday and were quickly seated (outdoors in our case as it was a stunningly beautiful Southern Nevada morning).

Service was outstanding!  I ordered the Spaghetti and meatballs and my wife, the salmon.  Both came with as side salad.  My spaghetti wasn't as sweet as my homemade sauce but that's not unusual.  My wife enjoyed her salmon and brought the leftovers home.  Lunch did take a little time to arrive but that gave us time to enjoy our appetizer (a daily special) and salad.  

Lunch cost us $50 so it was a little pricey but you definitely get your money's worth.
Good food, good service, can't go wrong.  Patio is great this time of year. My favorite dish is the fetuccini tocco. Calamari is a great appetizer.

Wow!  Thanks "YELP" for a fantastic find for out-of-town visitors searching for fresh cuisine!  We are spending just a few days in Las Vegas enroute to our final destination and wanted a fun restaurant with a great Happy Hour and quality food and drinks. We tried Prosecco our first night and have been back every night since to explore Prosecco's culinary creations.  Be sure to ask the friendly staff for the daily specials that local residents crave. Special shout-outs to knowledgeable staff members Brandy, Teya, Nico, and especially Giuseppe (he looks so much like martial arts master Steven Seagal that I had to order everything he recommended .... and it was DELICIOUS!! :)

We had dinner at this restaurant last week. It was the BEST osso bucco my husband has ever had
He wants this to be his "last meal" if he is going to die soon. The staff is wonderful 
The service is impeccable. Can't say enough good. 
So we had such a great experience last week....we had to go back this week! We were not disappointed. The food was excellent, the service does not disappoint. Definitely worth trying. Better than any other Italian restaurant we have tried in Las Vegas!

Came here because of yelp reviews, and I was so glad we came! Arrived for lunch menu and ordered the calamari to start. The calamari was breaded lightly and the marinara was extremely tasty.  The calamari was tender and not rubbery at all. For the main course I ordered the lobster ravioli with the shrimp saffron sauce and it was the most delicious creme sauce I've ever had. The service was great...Claudio was our waiter and he was friendly, accommodating and answered all my questions regarding the menu. I highly recommend this little gem.

Great authentic Italian restaurant. The first time I visited I was very impressed. Ever since it's been my go to place for fine Italian food. Service is always great. I strongly recommend it to locals and tourists.

Been here two times since the opening ( about two weeks ego) 
Great food , really extensive menu! Anyone  can find something to own taste. 
Pretty good wine list. Oh , and our bartender Teya- true Rock star! Amazing drinks! 
They also have nice happy hour 3-6 everyday including weekend! 
My new favorite local spot!

Great experience! Came here for brunch. Ordered the egg in a nest. Soft boiled eggs on spinach with potatoes, peppers, and cheese fondue sauce. Delish. Husb ordered the Morning Star. Too many potatoes but otherwise good. Mimosa was a nice touch. Friendly service, live music. Recommend.

I was looking for a nice place to grab something to eat and have a glass of wine. This place is great, the food is amazing. I sat at the bar and was greeted by Tia the bartender. She is professional with a great attitude. I got a glass of prosecco and was served fresh bread with some kind of delicious dip. I wasn't very hungry so I only ordered the calamari and they were sooo good. 
I am definitely going back to this place and bringing friends :D 
See you soon!

First time being at this restaurant. Oh the food were so good. They provide you with good bread with oil. Short rib was so tender and flavorful. Salmon was big and cooked so tender. The best part on top of all the yummy dinner was dessert! I usually order tiramisu every time I go Italian restaurant. Tiramisu here is far more beautiful and sophisticated flavor. Not so small or big. Just perfect!  Service was great. I will definitely come back here. Highly recommend this place!
Fantastic food in a beautiful restaurant!  The flavors are very authentic with impeccable service.  So great to have Italian this good in this area.  Bravo!

Great Italian restaurant with great service. I've been here a few times and this place does not disappoint. Perfect place for a date night or girls night out. I've always sat at the bar since I'm a speciality cocktail type girl I always feel like everything always tastes better at the bar. I have not tried anything here that I don't like . Lobster ravioli is a must.

All I can say is the service was so slow. There was one other couple in the restaurant. From taking our order/asking for drinks to bringing out bread to actually getting food and waiting for our desert orders. The food was good but with so many great Italian places on or near Eastern we won't probably be back.

I wanted to like this place based on other reviews but I unfortunately I did not.  The food was okay, really nothing special.  I had the Pollo Limone e Capperi and It wasn't very lemony and while there were capers I couldn't really taste them.  I also had the tiramisu for dessert and it was soggy so i couldn't each much of it.  A good thing was the service was pretty good, they were attentive and very nice however there weren't many people in the restaurant so I'm sure if their attention is due to the lack of customers or if they're normally like that.

Best find in Henderson! 
Prepare yourself because you will crave this place multiple times a week. The authentic italian cuisine and service is awesome! I'm actually addicted   
Tonight I have to brag about my dish called the Ossobuco special. My taste buds are going insane at the moment. This dish is a Perfectly braised short rib, with a rosemary red tomato sauce, on a bed of saffron risotto. One word: Omg!

Not sure how anyone would give this place less than 5 stars!

First let me start by saying the atmosphere here is great.  I went this weekend and they have a guy playing the sax to all sorts of different music.  So fun!  The service is fantastic, and you won't have less than half a glass of water, EVER!

The food, however, is the best part.  I've lived in Vegas for 6 years now and been to so many great Italian places, but none this good (including i Mulino, carbone... etc). Prosecco has the best meatballs I've ever had and every entree/side I've ever gotten has been 5 stars. 

I can't stress enough, go here.  Everything is fantastic. I have an old client coming in town tonight and this is where I'm having him meet me for dinner!
Really amazing Italian kitchen. Awesome atmosphere, service, and of course great Italian food.

I was a returning customer to Prosecco.... up to today. 
I placed an order with Yelp / Eat24, received a confirmation by email and I waited.... waited.... waited.... After more than 1 hour, I called the restaurant. The lady who pick up my call told me they didn't get any order from me / Eat24 and she told me also "we're closed tonight"...Uhhh seriously ? You're closed and you answer the phone ?!! 
So I decided to take my car ( I was still expecting to get my order... ). 
The restaurant was open, we talked to the staff.... maybe it was the manager(s) or the owner(s) I don't know... but I really felt like they didn't care about our order or... us. They did not offer to do anything for us. Even not a smile. Rude attitude and unprofessional customer service. 
Congratulations guys : you lost a customer.

Cute little place! Friendly staff and great, reasonably priced food! I had the Fettuccine Tocco which was fabulous! The short ribs melted in your mouth! My sister had the ravioli formaggio which was good as well (not as good as mine...teehee). Also had the strawberry crepe which was a nice, tasty, light dessert. The only reason I did not give it a 5 star is that it is a tad bit noisy and it was a little difficult having a conversation.

Great food and atmosphere. Top-to-bottom the menu is amazing and all of the staff is very friendly. If you get a chance, introduce yourself to the owner Nico, very friendly guy and has a lot of passion for the place. If you like seafood definitely try the black ink pasta with shrimp!

I'm from out of town so I took advantage of their delivery service. I ordered the bruschetta and the spaghetti and meatballs dinner. The bruschetta was amazingly good. There is a small spread of ricotta on the toasted bread and they used small sweet Tomatoes and it was absolutely delicious. The spaghetti and meatballs looked rather plain when I opened up the container but I have to tell you it was so good! The meatballs were so tender and tasty. The marinara sauce although simple was very good. They also sent a small loaf of Italian bread with a container of olive oil infused with fresh basil. The bread was that true rustic Italian bread. The olive oil was light and tasty and the fresh basil in it was so good! I would recommend this without hesitation to anyone asking for a good Italian meal and if I stay at this hotel again I won't hesitate to get food from this restaurant. It was so delicious

We stumbled upon this by accident, and it was the most Wonderful find. The atmosphere, the service, and most of all the food was wonderful. They had several specials plus the menu, which was hard to choose from. Both our meals, plus our appetizer were amazing. We are so glad we found this little gem and will definitely be back. It was  busy for a Friday and we had no reservation. They said it was no problem and sat us.  The restaurant is super clean. We had a great meal and Teya  was our mixologist / server. she was extremely helpful and makes the best Expresso martini ever.  GO... You'll fall in love.

Wow! That's what I am going to say again! WOW! Fantastic, authentic Italian food, not NY Italian, not Italian American but more Roma Style with a touch Taormina. They don't bang you out with nonsense and over rated prices and wine list. Prosecco is done right at the right price and amazing service. As you can see from my other reviews, I am rather picky and snobbish when it comes to food because of my 30 years executive Chef credentials. Believe me or not but believe me, you will not be disappointed at all and you will walk out feeling good about just happened. I highly recommend Prosecco. You will thank me.

We went to Prosecco based on the great Yelp reviews and boy were we NOT disappointed!  

The atmosphere is great.  The food/wine was spectacular.  Rhonda (our waitress) was funny, pleasant and helpful with the menu; she made dinner that much better!

They had an off the menu tomahawk steak!

If you're looking for a remarkable and affordable Italian restaurant give Prosecco a try!

Came here less than 40 minutes before they were closing and my boyfriend and I were greeted with the best service. I'm use to restaurants being extremely irritated when you dine in near closing, not this place. We were seated immediately and our server or servers (we definitely had more than one) came over timely to take our drink order. The place wasn't crowded but there was definitely a steady crowd for a Thursday night. While my boyfriend had wine I opted for just water so I can't speak on their wine selection but from what I saw they have a book full of different red and white wines. I ordered the Caesar salad and my boyfriend ordered the minestrone soup. Both were absolutely delicious. The salad is big enough for 2. I couldn't finish it by myself so we ended up sharing it. They brought out bread with some type of olive oil dressing/spread. Whatever it was, it was good. When I asked for vinegar as well our server kind of looked at me dumbfounded for a second and then brought out vinegar but with no saucer bowl. Idk maybe that's an east coast thing, olive oil and vinegar with bread. I had the spaghetti and meatballs and it was absolutely superb. The sauce was simple and delicate yet flavorful and the meatballs were big but not too thick whereas they end up dry in the middle. The meatballs were delicious down to every bite. Towards the end of our meal a gentleman who seemed to me as though he was the owner came by our table to check on us and ask about our meal which we raved about. This place has a romantic and sophisticated vibe. I love the design. The bar area has TVS which truly gives it a different vibe over in that area. Overall we enjoyed our food and will definitely return.

Had another amazing meal here again probably my fifth or sixth time here in three months....
Beef carpaccio was amazing and so was the short rib!!!

Great addition to Henderson restaurant scene. Spaghetti and meat ball marinara was phenomenal. Calamari  perfectly cook. Ruby beet  salad with candy pecans was phenomenal. All entrées came out hot and fresh. Service was excellent and a great atmosphere will definitely come back a lot.
We found this restaurant by mistake, however, this is one of the best Italian restaurant we have been in. Great food, hospitality, we enjoy every moment. Def worth it. Enjoy

What can I say about this restaurant? It's awesome! This neighborhood restaurant is a great place to have a nice dinner with family, friends or date night. The staff is friendly and very attentive. Even the owner/chef walks through to check on the patrons. The menu is not overwhelming, not too pricey and the food is terrific. We had the Linguini and Stuffed Lobster Tail and Spinach Pasta with African Shrimp (huge shrimp!). There's also a bar area with TV's to have a cocktail if you prefer. It is a small place so I would recommend making reservations We can't wait to visit again in the future and highly recommend it.

Service was great. The staff was very attentive. The bread was fresh and warm as was the tomato and mozzarella. I had a chicken and caper dish, my boyfriend had chicken parm, my friend had a pasta and braised rib dish. Every dish was delicious.

I decided to order for pickup because my kids wanted Italian for dinner. First, they got a really good menu, and everything on the menu sounded really good. I got the spaghetti marinara with meatball, and my kids got a cream pasta, mixed in with a little tomato sauce. I cant remember what it was called, but overall, the food was fantastic. This restaurant is very close to where I live, so now, this has become my go to spot for Italian food cravings. Definitely give this place a try, I can confidently say, you won't be disappointed.

Snooty Italian staff to greet you. Overpriced off the Strip food with decent portion sizes but not worth the hype. The flavors of the dishes we sampled were bland (calamari $13, shrimp paprika $29, and chicken parm $24)...we skipped dessert as even their Gelato was $8 and for two people with drinks we were already reached $100.  Price wasn't the driving decision here it certainly would be worth it for the taste and service were lackluster. No plans to refer or return.

One of my new favorite Italian restaurants in the Henderson area. At first glance, you would never expect the inside of the restaurant to be what it is from looking at the outside. The inside is absolutely gorgeous and the customer service was amazing!

The pasta is made from scratch and when you taste it, it has a fresh taste to it. Very lite and fresh, which it was delicious. I had the ravioli with the asparagus cream sauce. I also sampled the chicken, and it was cooked perfectly. Everything I had here was lite, fresh, and not to heavy but with an absolutely amazing taste. 

I will be returning here for sure. And A+ for the service, some restaurants it's hard to find how great of service it is here.

A little gem of a restaurant right in our neighborhood.  I dined there with 3 other friends, we all loved it!  Food tasted great, our server was very attentive, which was surprising because we were all women!  Generally, women get the short shrift where service is concerned, not so at Prosecco.  Kudos to the staff and Chef, also the entire kitchen staff, our meal exceeded our expectations!  All of us will be recommending Prosecco to family & friends.  I hope others in our neighborhood try this restaurant, unless you have already discovered it!

Prosecco where the food is just the beginning, we started with wood-fire pizza principessa style and the service was amazing.
Our waiter mourat suggested veal valdostana which is pounded veal chop filled with prosciutto and fontina cheese, lightly breaded over arugula salad.
Finished with a great affogato gelato yumyyyyyyy.
