I will return very soon and bring all my friend.
Everyone deserves great Italian food and this is the one place always will be great Italian food

Have dined here multiple times since it opened recently and this is definitely one of my go-to Italian spots. The owner and chef are both from Italy and that reflects in the menu and taste of the food. Make sure to hear the daily special when you go, I've had it two of the three times I've been and each time was fantastic. I love trying new dishes and My favorite so far is the black squid ink pasta!  It looks strange bc the sauce was black but man what an amazing dish!  Worth a trip no matter what part of town you live in or if visiting!

Great Italian food. We are foodies and Italian is my second favorite. We have been to most of the Italian restaurants in LV. This is a new one and it is worth checking out. I had the lobster ravioli. They were great and the lemon butter sauce was maybe the best I have had. Service was good with very friendly wait staff. Prices are very reasonable with a good selection of Italian and American wines. Try it, you will like it.
Great place ,nice atmosphere fresh owners spirit amazing dressing for the bread, Parmesan eggplant is my favorite dish .

Pricey but excellent service and excellent fresh food
Good to know you can find a nice Italian restaurant near Vegas

The restaurant was recommended by a friend. My first visit was tonight for dinner and what a fined. This restaurant will be listed as one of my best.  Everything was perfect! The service, food and ambiance is just what I want. Who could ask for anything more. The grilled octopus was amazing to start followed by a fresh salad. I had the special which was a whole Dover that they deboned table side.  We also had the  fresh home made ravioli stuffed with lobster. Oh my lord my palette was dancing with joy. The owner Giuseppe was warm and welcoming to us. Will definitely be my go to for Italian food. My complements to the chef.
Another amazing local spot! If there are two of you, start with a glass of Prosecco. Get a bottle of Jordan. Share the Chef Platter for two and ravioli aragosta and finish with a cannoli! Amazing!!!

the food was amazing!! When I took my first bite it was like heaven. The server was very friendly and on top of things. Will definitely be back. I was there Halloween night and our server was a a man. Wish I could remember his name but I think there was only 1 server there but he did a great job anyways. Of the owners see this great service.

This is a friendly, comfortable local restaurant with fresh food. The pasta they tell me is from Italy, which is why it tasted better than the stuff I serve at home. I had the lobster pasta with shrimp, (which were few) and my guy had meatball pasta. Both were very delicious. The service was friendly and prompt. The owners were there, greeting everyone and answering questions. It was a little noisy inside. Maybe next time we'll sit outside.

Been looking for a nice local Italian restaurant and finally found one. Nice interior and quite, I could actually hear my dinner partner talk. The food was very good. The only complaint was the service, one gal was working away, but the guy who was suppose to bring us the check was way to slow. And the hostess could have helped out. 
Came back with my husband. I had the eggplant , burnt my mouth and the dish tasted of only cheese. My husband had a pasta dish that was supposed to be spicy but wasn't. Serve was still bad and this time the food was subpar. Won't come back.

Fantastic restaurant! Superb service! Great vegan options. The staff went above and beyond to make our party, including 3 kids, feel welcome. My nephew ordered a cheese pizza and French fries were added - a true surprise and delight moment of the evening. Very nice decor throughout and quality wine glasses. Loved the salt scrub in the women's restroom!
Nice authentic Italian restaurant! Fresh and beautiful medley of colors. They offer gluten free and vegan dishes. Bread is so so good! Come try!

This is hands down my favorite authentic Italian restaurant ! Everything on the menu is delicious . We had the fried octopus to start and beet salad . Then I ordered the special which consisted of striped bass, mussels, clams, lobster, and shrimp. The dishes had so much flavor we really enjoyed our meal. We've been here a couple times and it's always been good.
Food is amazing!! Worth the price to get good food. Great wine selection and full bar. Outside seating and awesome service

I have a friend on fb who was saying that she absolutely loved this place so i wanted to check it out. Now for the pros....The restaurant is nice it was completely remodeled. Our server was super friendly and attentive. Cons...As far as the food and prices I wasn't too impressed. I had the Cannelloni Gratinati it was ok but not for the price. It says on the yelp menu $14.00 it's actually $16.00 once you get there. Please change the prices on here :/. Also surprising is that with these price you don't get a side salad? My sister had the lasagna and my mom the eggplant both were ok but again not for the price. I could see having these prices if your on the strip but your not. I probably won't visit again there's too many other Italian restaurants in town with better prices and better food. Giving three stars for decor and server.

Came here with a group on a Friday night. No reservations and got a table quickly. Service was good. Everyone enjoyed their meals. We ate a LOT of bread (because it was yummy) while we waited for the food to come. Will come back.
What an experience!! Great food and great staff, also Nico is very nice. I definitely recommend for a date night!!

SUMMARY: If possible, I'd rate 4.5. The food is very, very good---but portions quite small, and delivery charge is high at $6.

Overall, $40 spendy for 4 pieces of ravioli, 3 ping-pong-sized meatballs, and a piece of tiramisu size of a *small* square drink coaster.

DETAILS: Stumbled upon Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen on a night when there was no food in the house and decided to order out. It is too expensive to do this very often, but it was incredibly delicious, fresh, and thoughtfully and expertly prepared.

My Order:  Agnolotti di Zucca ("Moon-shaped pasta with butternut squash and ricotta cheese sautéed in a light butter sage sauce") -- very modest portion, but exceptionally good -- hand-crafted pasta, like a ravioli, the sauce was just as described, perfectly seasoned, and accented with a jot of fried sage. 

Ordered a side of meatballs, which was fortunate, because the portion of the entree would have been insufficient a meal -- with the 3 meatballs, it was perfection! The meatballs were scrumptious, served in its own little container with a flavorful marinara sauce, with a little bit of accenting cheese over the top, and bits of fresh basil. They mischarged me for thee meatballs at $6.00---I later learned their standard charge for THREE MEATBALLS (which, again, are ping-pong-ball-sized) is $18.

The meal also came with wonderful, fresh, bread--and an herbed dipping oil. Complex, subtle, and delicious.

One review said that this very oil "needed seasoning," by which I'm guessing they meant salt.  

However, one of the *best* parts of this restaurant--unlike most of the quite pedestrian restaurants you can order from in this region---htheir restraint in "seasoning" (meaning: salt) throughout the entire meal was a relief, and let you actually taste thee natural flavors--not just a salt bomb.

For desert I tried tiramisu--which was wonderful, and in keeping with the thoughtful "seasoning" of the savory dishes, it was not overly sweet. Most places in the Las Vegas Valley, I ave found, smash you over the head with sugar. This didn't.  My first impression was the tiramisu was on the teeny tiny side. However: like everything else, it was of the very highest quality, and in factm among the best tiramisu I've had, with slim slices of homemade, ever-so-slightly sweet cocoa/chocolate "bark" perched on top in addition to the traditional nice bitter cocoa dusting of tiramsu. The cream/custard was sublime. And there was a wee dollop of chantilly cream to the side, along with a spriglette of mint. The only misfire of the whole meal was a 1/2 maraschino cherry in the cream. At first I thought it was a raspberry, which would have been nice, but a maraschino cherry? An ironic wink, perhaps? But unnecessary.

The meal before tax and delivery-tip was $28---for one smallish but delectable entree plus 3 very modest-sized meatballs.   The delivery fee of $6 seemed high.  All told, it was $40 with tax and delivery and tip.

This quality of restaurant--the elevated taste--is rare near Henderson.  Most places that deliver, particularly, tend toward mediocre, run-of-the-mill, and/or chains.  Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen is unique, smart, creative, and could hold its own, and be popular, in any major city with an educated clientele with high expectations and discerning palates. But for me, given the price, a once-in-a-while splurge!

Delicious.  Very friendly and attentive staff.    Our waiter Claudio was awesome     Ordered the Chef's  Platter for two as appetizer.   Imported  Salumi , cheeses and veggies.    They have Moretti on tap another bonus.   Our dinners were wonderful.  Excellent food.   Fresh and well made.  Will be back.  What a gem!!!
Great spot. The food is amazing and they deliver. I really like this place for lunch. I haven't been for dinner yet . Will try soon

Excellent food, excellent service! Found this place via yelp (of course) and they have well deserved 4.5 *plus* stars. Staff was super friendly and progressional, the owner was rotating and checking on tables and the hostess was delightful. I'll be back! I'll let the food speak for itself!!

Great food. Great atmosphere. Great bar.  The staff is very friendly. The place is very clean. The pizza here is some of the best in town. And the bread and oil dip is amazing.  I always ask for some dip to go which they happily oblige. Love this place!!!  And it's open for lunch which is very nice.
The Margarita was sooo good!!! It was one of the great pizza I've eaten(: other foods were also delicious, and the tastes were sensitive and rich.  I'd like to go again!!!

Wonderful food, great service, beautiful evening!
We love the Happy Hour here but tonite enjoyed a delicious dinner on the patio, one of the best Italian meals in along time!
Bread was yummy and crusty, dip was flavorful and just the right amount of seasoning, all our meals were 'luck the plate' deserving!
A true neighborhood gem....will frequent here, for sure!

Excellent service and food high in quality. This place is a hidden gem. Tucked away in a corner on Eastern & Pebble Rd. We went on a Wednesday evening and this placed was packed.  The owner Giuseppe came and greeted us. I had veal osso buco and my girl had a veal dish that was to die for. Will be back very soon.

My mom and I decided to try this new place for lunch, it was INCREDIBLE!! I am a picky eater and not a fan of tomatoes or tomato based sauces. I asked if they had a regular fettuccine Alfredo as I didn't see it on the lunch menu. They have it on their dinner menu so they were able to accommodate my request. When we got our food it was a generous portion and it was absolutely DELICIOUS!! You could tell instantly that the pasta was home made as it was light and airy. The sauce was a perfect creaminess with just the perfect hint of garlic (not over powering at all). My mom got their Tacchino Sandwich and again, it was a generous portion and all of the ingredients were a perfect ratio to each other.  The bread was warm and the cheese was completely melted and tasted like it had just come out of the brick oven. The restaurant atmosphere is clean and simple yet rustic decor. All of the staff was so friendly, it truly was a great experience. Mom and I cannot wait to bring our husbands to Vegas' new Italian gem!!

When I first walked into the restaurant I was greeted with amazing welcoming staff :) 
The food was amazing ! The recommendations by our waiter was on point . 
I couldn't be any happier than my first experience at this amazing restaurant . 

Thank you Nico !:)

This truly is a little gem. The pastas are fresh and homemade, the service is great, and the owner is such a nice man. The restaurant made me a special dish (funny eating habits) that was great; my husband had the lasagna and said it was outstanding; our friend had the lobster linguine and she said it was amazing. They have a very good menu and a good wine selection.

Reserved for a large party of 20 people for Sunday brunch.  They had the tables ready as soon as we got there and we were seated immediately.    Wait staff was very attentive and prompt.  We had a couple people in the party order bottomless drinks and they kept the mimosas and bellinis coming!!! You can get bottomless for $19 and choose between 4 different drinks or just order by the glass for $6.  They are all very tasty so a great way to start your morning.   They have a variety of options for brunch, most of the party ordered the steak and eggs or the lobster ravioli.   Food was delicious, my steak and eggs were cooked perfectly, seasoned just right and the ravioli that I tasted had a plentiful amount of lobster and shrimp.   

A great touch to a relaxing meal was the saxophone player.  He's very talented and we're surprised he was able to keep going without a break during our entire meal.    

Great food and great service.

I will preface this review with the fact that I am Italian and I am from Long Island, N.Y (roll your eyes, but the fact remains I know great authentic Italian food)..

Ordered delivery from this establishment this evening via EAT24. I have been dying to try it.. as authentic Italian cuisine is obviously up my alley, especially on days when I don't feel like cooking. Ordered a margherita pizza, calamari, and tiramisu. I figured the old standbys should give me a sense of quality with this place.

Delivery was 20 minutes earlier than the EAT24 app estimated. Great!  Everything should be hot then. Wrong!  Pizza and calamari were stone cold. Tiramisu was so-so.

I'm half dressed (Hello! Hence delivery), so I couldn't really run after the delivery guy.  I immediately put the tiramisu in the fridge and heat my oven to 500 degrees, in hopes of saving the pizza. While the oven was going, I attempted to place the pizza on my pizza stone and it was such a project because of how soggy it was. Still, I hoped that I could save it in the oven.

I start eating the calamari, which was edible and probably my favorite part next to the complimentary rustic bread (that's where your 1 star came from, thumbs up on the bread and tapanade). $13

When the pizza came out, it was even worse than when I put it in. I gave up and just ate it because I was so hungry. Flavor was "eh" on top of it. I make a better margherita pizza at home. I'm so disappointed and I was most looking forward to this pizza, I wanted to love it so much. $11

Tiramisu pictures from being served in the restaurant (posted by other Yelpers) show a nice, huge piece of my favorite dessert. That's why I ordered it at $6 a slice. My slice is the tinest piece of cake I have ever had from a restaurant. 

With tip, I paid an even $40 for utter disappointment all the way around. But here's my tip for YOU, Prosecco.. if the quality of your food cannot be upheld, and the integrity of your product is at stake during the delivery process, DON'T OFFER THE SERVICE.

We went here for Sunday brunch. The manager (owner?) Nico, our waiter (didn't catch his name, #7) and the saxophone player were all amazing! Portion sizes and prices are very fair and the food was excellent. The waiter went out of his was to help us out when we didn't have cash for the saxophone player. We tipped him an extra $10 and he put the $10 into the tip jar in front of us. We will definitely be back!

Started with carpaccio, pretty standard and burratina, spot on especially after taking our server's suggestion of not having the prosciutto fried.  All entrees were huge.  My seafood linguine had a lot of seafood, all very fresh except for mussels which tiny and rubbery(over cooked?).  Daughter had cappelini with shrimp...very standard.  Hubby had spaghetti with meatball.  Meatballs were huge but not what we're used to...it was very grounded with a lot of breading and barely had any taste of meat.  Excellent and attentive service.  Would definitely come back and try other dishes.
Fantastic food, excellent wine cellar, delicious desserts.....what more does one want? Oh and great ambience as well!

What a beautiful restaurant! The food was amazing! I got the cioppino, we also loved the veal & lobster supreme pasta! True Italian food with a great ambiance & modern feel. Even has a nice bar area of you want to catch the game and have some pizza from the brick oven. I love the open kitchen as well. 6 stars if I could!
We were seated for 20 minutes before the waiter came to greet us and waited another 10 min without drinks before we decided to just leave.

Solid brunch. Bottomless really means bottomless here and service is complimentary and continuous. The food is interesting as it's more Italian (I.e. many pasta offerings rather than traditional hash and waffles) but still enough options for a brunch aficionado. I had the shrimp and lobster omelette and the person I was with had the salmon pasta. The pasta was devoured in a tasty vodka sauce and could have been a suitable dish for brunch, lunch, or dinner. The omelette seemed a little empty outside the seafood, but was good once the toppings of avocado and tomato were sort of mixed in. The bottomless was top notch and worth all $19 for sure. And the prosecco they use is very sweet so be sure to ask for additional prosecco for side pours to make the brunch more memorable. Prosecco is solid and with the patio seems a nice leisurely Sunday on many occasions.
Great service, great environment, amazing specials that'll make you completely forget about what's on the menu.
Had the pasta that is rolled around in the cheese in front of you and it was super bland that i didnt even wanna finish it. Try using some salt in your dishes

Seriously authentic Italian food. I knew the owners must be Sicilian and Southern Italian because their special was pasta with black ink sauce- very Sicilian. Then I overheard a conversation in Italian, and finally heard my favorite Italian pop star, Jovanotti playing in the background. With all of this observed as I sat down I asked for a Moretti and wouldn't you know it- they have it dark and light and on tap. 

I really didn't even need a menu. I had to try the calamari and eggplant. Eggplant is my personal  test that soooo many Las Vegas Italian restaurants fail. I am a Jersey/New York transplant who had a 100 year old grandmother from Calabria cook me meals every weekend until her death. I am not easy to impress.

The calamari was perfectly cooked, my son loved it and their red sauce was spicy but not crazy hot. The eggplant was done the right way- not some crazy California interpretation. It was just a little mushy in the center, but eggplant parm is not easy.

The gelato and cannoli were excellent! The menu said Sicilian cannoli and it does the island proud. The service was very good, very friendly and I look forward to returning with friends and family. 

Mille grazie, Prosecco!

This has been a restaurant I've been meaning to try! I am so glad I did! My boyfriend and I went out for a date night and this was the perfect spot. It's hard to find a restaurant this nice off of the boulevard. From the attentive, welcoming service to the perfectly set table and INCREDIBLE food... everything was wonderful. I highly suggest the lobster ravioli; it blew my mind.

Nice atmosphere. Good selection on the menu. Prosecco salad was delicious! Margherita pizza was good. All food was light and not greasy which I enjoyed. A lot of fresh ingredients. Fettuccine bolognese was a little bland but it did the trick for lunch. Fairly priced.

May not be the best review as we ordered take out and did not dine in but food was really bland. We ended up seasoning and adding veggies from the fridge to brighten and add flavor. The dipping sauce that came with the bread was the best and had all the flavor the main courses didn't. We ordered the pasta in lemon and olive oil, which didn't have that fresh citrus flavor.
One of the best Italian restaurants in Vegas! The pasta tasted very fresh and the service was friendly. I hope to return very soon.
Food was wonderful! Best Italian around. Chicken piccata is our favorite. Server was attentive and wine was great.

I had dinner for the first time at Prosecco today...
It's a cozy Italian restaurant and the atmosphere is warm and inviting and the staff makes you feel like family.
The food is amazing and you can see for your self...
If you are looking for a authentic Italian restaurant you have to visit this place!

LOVE.  
This restaurant is on Eastern and the 215- which is a short drive for me.  The atmosphere is classy and yet casual.  
My husband and I sat at the bar for a drink before the rest of our party arrived.  We were there early enough on a Saturday that it wasn't too busy.  The bartender recommended wine, and I loved what she let me taste- a special reserve Chianti.  The second time I went to this restaurant, I had Prosecco which was also great.
We had the burrata cheese appetizer and carpaccio which was excellent.  The entrees were all fantastic- and desert was even better.  
I love that the owner/chef walked around to talk to people, and the bussers/waiters were friendly and attentive.  
If you are looking for authentic Italian, off the strip, this is the place to check out.  I will be going back!

Food was excellent.  Large window opening into kitchen from dining room.  Looked like you could eat off the floor it was so clean.  Staff was very friendly and welcoming.  Service from the kitchen was VERY slow.  This was the only reason I did not give it 5 stars!

What an amazing experience.  Our fab server Rhonda told us about the specials and we couldn't resist. We started with Calamari with spicy marinara. Definitely worth a go. Crunchy and spicy, not chewy. Then my wife had the double stuffed pork chop. So big she could finish, not to mention tasty.  The ricotta cheese stuffing was to die for. We opted for the seafood ravioli.  They were cooked perfectly with more seafood on top and a light tomato based sauce. Desserts were a delight: creme brulee style custard and I had the Nutella and banana crepes both had the best cappuccino we've had in forever. Be sure to ask to have Rhonda wait on you. Kind pleasant service that's not overbearing. We will be back!

Great new neighborhood restaurant!  Especially convenient if you are doing "dinner and a movie" at the Regal Colonnade next door.  The dining atmosphere was upscale, the staff friendly and attentive.  The portions were ample, the pricing was fair, the menu was extensive and the presentation, artistic.  We started with warm, fresh crusty bread served with an olive oil tapenade.  Our entrees were the daily special, osso buco, the chicken Parm and the pasta with short rib.  All dishes were tasty and well-prepared.   Everything was superbly orchestrated under the watchful eye of Giuseppi, the owner.  Reservations recommended for weekend dining as this local gem has already been discovered.

I was so excited about Prosecco, I live so close and couldn't wait to make this my new Italian spot. I've been here two times before and something's always been a little off but it wasn't worth mentioning. But today will be the last time I ever step foot in this restaurant. I decided to stop in for lunch, I had the Caesar salad to start and it was terrible. Oh my gosh the lettuce was wilted, yellow and a little red I was actually scared to take one bite. I couldn't believe they would try to pass that off to anyone but nevertheless things happen so it wasn't the end of the world. What bothered me was the servers reaction to our concerns and also that it was still on the bill at the end. When we mentioned it he seemed so irritated. Also, being here previously I was expecting the delicious complimentary bread and olive oil but it never came and I never mentioned it because I assumed that it must be just for dinner service. I was really disappointed when I saw that the two tables beside us were offered the bread. Maybe I'm looking too much into it but words can't describe how this type of service can make a person feel, was it the way we looked, the way we were dressed? I don't know, but being in this industry myself, I expected so much more.

Perfect date night restaurant! Food is authentic and fresh and the restaurant is decorated very well. Started with the calamari which was lightly breaded and fried--good but Pizza Rock's calamari is still my fav. My husband had the cannelloni, which was the best I've ever tasted. I had the meatballs--small portion but surprisingly filling and very tasty. One of their specials was making fettuccini tableside in a wheel of Parmesan with a porcini mushrooms sauce--this looked incredible! Unfortunately being diabetic I couldn't order it but I did drool when it was being prepared at other tables! Our bill was $80 which is not bad at all for an upscale date night--we will be back!
This restaurant is fantastic! Food was amazing, drinks were great and service was superb. Would highly recommend this restaurant.

After seeing the location I was very hesitant to even try this place. But man am I so glad I did. The food is on point ! I've got to say is probably the best spaghetti and meatballs I've ever had in my life. Highly recommend giving this place a shot.

This is a standard setting Italian restaurant. As I told one employee, Italian is easy to prepare, difficult to differentiate. The Insalada Caprese was the real treat. The wine list short but high end. My lasagna was great as well. I'll come back some time.

We came here on a whim one Saturday night. The restaurant is very close to our house and we've been dying to try it. It was busy but we were seated quickly. The staff is attentive and friendly. Everything we ordered was fresh and cooked perfectly. The prosecco custard was something new for us and it was fabulous! One of the best meals we've had in a long time! Love that it's in our neighborhood but it could easily fit right in with some of the best restaurants on the Strip.

After reading Roger E.'s many reviews of this local restaurant we thought we would give it a try.   
The location is twice the size of the old Round Table Pizza and very, very nicely decorated.   From the very first greeting you receive from  "Nicco" and the staff at the front, you know you are in an establishment that caters to the customer.
We were seated near the bar in a single sided booth with tables right next to us.  Not my favorite seating, especially for a cozy dinner with friends.  But, that was overshadowed by all the good aspects of this restaurant.  Our waitress was "Teya" who was also the bartender.  Sharp, classy and efficient.  She checked on us periodically and her assistants always kept our glasses full. 
Our group started with the Ruby salad which was very fresh and cold.  It would make an excellent lunch as it was large and tasty. For our main courses my guests had a chicken and veal dishe and I had the veal chop.  All very good with excellent accompanying sauces.  Dessert was a treat with our favorite being the banana Nutella crepe.
My only regret was waiting so long to try this place. We have been missing out on a great local dining establishment.  We might request a normal table or booth next time, and hope Teya can be our server once again !!!

We don't live near Henderson so when we do and we are hungry we have to pick a worthy place . This time we hit the nail on the head with Prosecco . This restaurant in a big strip mall is kind of unassuming but is really good . 

We ate at an odd time (2:30pm) so we were the only people on their patio . Service was Very attentive although the servers weren't under any pressure. Everything was attended to very quickly and courses were served back to back with no overlapping .

The dishes we ate 

Caesar salad - very good salad cold bowl and cold lettuce added to the wonderful crunch . The chunks of Parmesan in the salad were great and plentiful. 

Prosecco salad - mango , heirloom tomatoes , avocado , Persian cucumber and a nice creamy balsamic . 

Capellini pomodoro- really good angel hair with a light red sauce and basil . Really good classic dish . The Pasta was very fresh .

Cheese ravioli -The best dish of the day. Gray raviolis in a light creamy cheese (beschamel ) . Every bite a gluttonous delight.  Truly a great pasta dish. 

Overall we will be back again  . Even if we don't have to be on that side of town.

2nd time here and the food has Not disappointed! 

We came for an early Valentine's Day dinner and enjoyed an extended evening w our friends... 5 hrs + 

I enjoyed the Penne Vodka w chicken and hubby noshed on the Osso Bucco 

We also snatched a piece each of our friend's Margherita! Yummm, Napoli style!

Food is the closest you will get to eating in Italy. 

Location is ideal as well... right off the 215 / Eastern 

Qui, si, se mangia bene!

Your constant companion, 

~deirdra

The only true ITALIAN food in Henderson!  The best true Italian food I have tasted in years.
Customer service is was perfect. Like Vegas use to be 20 yrs. ago! Every part of our visit was perfect!  It's all about the customer! And perfect Italian food! Thank you so much!

Absolutely the best Italian restaurant in Henderson and probably our favorite place to go to in The Las Vegas area for Italian. Authentic and has a great ambiance. Quality of Service is amazing. Very consistent experience. Must have their Branzino and their Seafood pasta. Yum!

Last night was so amazing. Can't wait to go back

Decided to bring my mom here for an early Mother's Day dinner since she likes pizza. It's a bit more upscale than I thought. We came on a Saturday around 5pm so I thought we'd be the only ones, but there was already a large group and the tables started to fill up quickly. 

We ordered
- Grilled octopus, served on a bed of couscous 
- Ossobuco with a saffron risotto 
- Asparagus with lemon and butter sauce
- Pepperoni pizza with bell peppers and mushrooms added

My favorites were the veal shank and octopus. Both were so tender and seasoned just right for my taste. I wouldn't usually order asparagus, but my mom likes it so we ordered it. We both thought it was ok, but probably wouldn't order it again. The pizza was a bit salty for both of us and the crust was too thin...or maybe the topping was too heavy?! In any case, I prefer my pizza to be of the Unfloppy variety :) But it did force us to fold to eat it and look like we were from the east coast! 

Service and vibe were quite pleasant, food was mostly good, but the bill seemed a bit high considering we didn't have any drinks. So overall I give 3 stars using my very scientific method of taking the excellent service and 2 out of 4 dishes (5 stars), and subtracting for the 2 out of 4 so-so dishes, price value and likelihood I'd be back for dinner (2 stars), making it a strong average 3 star.

Good but not great.  Octopus app was well prepared. Ricotta and tomato bruschetta very colorful with sweet glaze on the tomatoes, but needs more ricotta to balance all the tomatoes  and bread. Lobster and shrimp ravioli in saffron cream sauce was beautifully presented but lacked overall flavor.  Seafood was generous in the seafood linguine but all were overcooked.

2nd time here and I don't rate or review often unless is amazing or shit.
BEST Italian food I have ever had.
Everything from the chefs platter filled with Italian meats,amazing cheeses and marinated veggies to the crust on the wood fired pizzas are to die for.
I love that everyone working there is Italian makes it feel so authentic.
You can't go wrong on anything you order. Sure to make you a regular. This place is perfect for foodies.

I've been here 3 times. I have taken my son (age 10) after work and I've been there once during lunch. I own a spa in the same center plus I live 2 minutes away. It's convenient. 

The service is quite good. They do their very best even when they are busy. There is a little disorganization during busy times however, everyone is friendly and I can tell that owners or investors are there or very hands on. They just opened and I'm truly impressed with their operating ability. It's obvious that there are passionate owners, I've been here 3 times. I have taken my son after work and I've been there once during lunch. I own Axiom Spa in the same center plus I live 2 minutes away. It's convenient. 

The service is quite good. They do their very best even when they are busy. There is a little disorganization during busy times however, everyone is friendly and I can tell that owners or investors are there or very hands on. They just opened and I'm truly impressed with their operating ability. It's obvious that there are passionate owners, investors and management. Being this new, it's amazing that they are doing this well and are this busy!

The food is great. The bread is warm and fresh tasting. I've had the chicken, steak, salads and calamari. Everything was good except the organic salad which was utterly overpowering sugary sweet. That is not the flavor one typically seeks when ordering a mixed green organic salad. Perhaps a vinaigrette or lemon dill and oil would be a bit lighter as not to overpower the fresh organic greens prior to a hardy main course. Other than one salad dressing issue I had during lunch, the food is on point. 

I've told my staff that they must give this place a try. I seldom review small businesses unless I have great things to say. I seldom post bad reviews unless my experience is a total fail! I am reviewing because as a business owner myself, we thrive on honest positive reviews. 

Will I return? Heck yes I will.  management. Being this new, it's amazing that they are doing this well and are this busy!

I'd say they are casual nice and older children friendly. Bring your tiny screaming baby and it will be disruptive in my opinion. This is far nicer place than Olive Garden (I refuse to eat there again). The decor is a bit romantic and chic. It's great for date night and families with older children. They play excellent music, light candles and dim the lights at sunset.

Will I return? Heck yes I will. This place just opened their doors and they are doing what few can do straight out the gate. I can see great things in the future for them.

Ate there yesterday, as usual.. great food, excellent service and fantastic atmosphere.
I laughed so hard after reading a review from a chef from San Francisco that didn't like the food but want a free dinner with his family there again for FREE.. LoL that was amusing and real funny.. I love reading the reviews on Yelp, there's always an free loading idiot there..
Food was def. good. Had the Chilean Sea bass which is always my go to. Compared to the bass I had recently this is different in a good way. Service was good as well.

Been in vegas for 12-13 years, living in Europe for 20 years before that, and let me tell you - have not had better Italian food! Prosecco is the top one restaurant in Vegas and Henderson combine. Tried their pizza and their pasta and i dont know what to say WOW! Just try it! thank you guys for the great hospitality! Top Restaurant!

We stopped here because of the nice patio.  The Prosecco salad was delicious, the half order was more than enough as a side salad and only $5. 
The cheese ravioli were homemade pastas and the cream sauce was light and not too heavy with a bit of asparagus mixed in. 
  Servers were friendly and knowledgeable. Prices were good and they offered lunch specials although we chose to order off the regular menu. 
  The only thing I disliked were the fake plants, but that is simply a personal preference.  The decor was beautiful and the ambiance comfortable.  
  Would definitely recommend this spot for lunch again and would try for dinner. They have a large wine selection also!
Best Italian food in vegas. Love this place.  Nico took very good care of us.  Definitely coming back!

Prosecco was absolutely amazing!  We had dinner there on Saturday night.  I had Dover sole which was deboned tableside.  It would have been good enough just by itself but it was served with a lemon butter sauce that made it remarkable.  My wife had a pasta dish with lobster and prawns.  The pasta was amazingly fresh, you could tell it was made from scratch.  Her lobster and prawns were also delicious.  Prosecco was one of the best dining experiences we have had in awhile and we will definitely come back again!

had dinner there for new year eve
very good deal
75$ 5 course meal
food was very good, you could feel the touch of a family owned restaurant, simple fares yet done in a complex manner, like the lentil soup, or the flourless choc cake
ill be back for lunch and dinner
great value , easy to find from the 215...
This place is incredible. True authentic Italian cuisine with a fantastic atmosphere. The food was amazing and the espresso martini from the bar was perfect. I highly recommend this place.

We had a lovely Father's Day Brunch at Prosecco today! The atmosphere was lively with laughter and beautiful live music! The food was out of this world...Amazing!!! My son and I shared the Eggs in a Nest and the Banana Nutella Crepes...both absolutely delicious! My husband enjoyed the Morning Star and couple mimosas...it was as a Happy Father's Day! So happy to have another fantastic place so close to home...We will definitely be back!

I've now been here two more times since my initial review and I don't hesitate to bump Prosecco up to the big 5*. The food I've tried is an easy 4-4.5*, and rounding up is a no-brainer given their solid wine list, availability of daily specials, and that they are open not just for lunch but all day as well.

On my last visit, my party did mostly specials - the octopus appetizer special was absolutely fantastic, perfectly cooked with lovely texture. We also split up a salmon fettuccine in vodka sauce, which was divine. I opted for the sea bass special which was also very well cooked, and a friend did the osso bucco over risotto. After I tried some, I had some regrets about not getting it!

Don't skip dessert either. I'm not a huge fan of the cannoli here but the prosecco-infused custard is to die for. I also enjoyed the small bit of tiramisu I managed to steal from another friend's plate.

All in all, super lucky to have another quality Italian option on this side of town.

Great date spot! Found this adorable restaurant through its raving reviews in Yelp. We just moved into the area and this place did not disappoint, absolutely fantastic!!! The menu is amazing from pizza to homemade pasta but, I stuck with a favorite of mine.. eggplant parmesan. It was to die for! The ingredients were very fresh, the tomato sauce was bright and extremely flavorful! 
We ordered a bottle of wine and neither my wine nor water glass were ever empty, the wait staff was on point. Rhonda was our waitress and was very helpful and kind. However, all of the wait staff assisted us, they seemed like a very functioning machine working together. Great food, amazing service and an extremely cute and comforting decor made for a wonderful dinner and I will be returning!

The service was great from the second we walked in. Authentic Italian waiters and chefs as well. Good atmosphere, delicious food! We ordered lasagna, butternut squash ravioli, eggplant Parmesan and Cannelloni. Everything was fantastic; no one was disappointed.

Ordered delivery a few days ago and was very disappointed. We ordered the spaghetti and meatballs and the lasagne. The food was delivered hot so that was nice. The flavor was very surprising. The lasagne tasted almost sour, as if the meat was bad. The spaghetti was ok, but really missed the savory mark. Very disappointed.

Food was great but the service wasn't quite there. The hostess was amazing but our server was over it.  I felt like it was a huge inconvenience that we were there. At one point I had to get up and search for him because he disappeared. No apology. The service doesn't reflect the service you would expect for the prices you pay.

I have two young daughters and much to my chagrin, they love Olive Garden. I don't mind it terribly; the OG is affordable, consistent, and very family friendly. But I was able to convince them to step out of their comfort zone to try a new Italian place in our neighborhood. Unfortunately, Prosecco didn't do enough to earn our return business.  
Service was friendly but slow. Waters sat empty. Drink orders were forgotten, came out wrong, and then to add insult to injury - double charged. Since it took 40 minutes for our food to come out we were now hungry, thirsty and annoyed. The kids love to play restaurant where they stand at the table and "take our order." Despite half the tables having kids with them, the owner came over and asked "are these yours?" (Our children) and then lectured us on how unsafe it is for them to be standing where waiters may be walking. 
It's a shame because the meatballs and calamari were both quite good. Clam linguine was pretty light on clams, including multiple shells that came out empty. 
I want to cheer the arrival of an upscale new restaurant but they left too much to be desired and worst of all left us feeling unwelcome. 
Ps over $100 for an appetizer, a side, an entree, a kids meal and wine.
Ordered take out and loved the pasta with Vodka sauce! The pizza cane with salami instead of pepperoni a tiny bit odd but ok! Just salty.
Trendy ambiance but comfortable ! Good seafood and great bar! Good service and value for price! Very fresh ingredients. Will go back

Amazing place! 
Food was fresh and spectacular! Service was the best it can be. 

We ordered the buratina that came with prosciutto and the carpaccio for starters. They were simple but high quality dishes. 
They give complimentary bread that was crispy fresh and very interesting yummy dipping from olive oil and herbs. 
For the main dishes we got home made ravioli with butter nut squash filling and sage butter sauce, and my friend got rigatoni with tomato sauce, mushrooms and chicken.

As for service, our waiter was quick, very patient to all of my questions and very nice and pleasant.  

I absolutely loved this place and will be coming back.
Very friendly and helpful staff, food is excellent! I'm very picky with Italian food. I was surprised that the pasta was cool correctly!

I think I found my favorite Italian restaurant here in Vegas :) great service, atmosphere and food was absolutely delicious. Pizza was a good price for its size, chicken and I had the lobster/shrimp ravioli. Bread was also good :) my moms boyfriend got a coffee and he loved it. Also whatever desert they have us for my moms birthday was very good. I'll
Be coming back :)

Great atmosphere that accommodates to larger parties and/or for couples. Food is very fresh/authentic Italian and the staff are very professional. Dinner prices are reasonable, chicken limoné was fantastic and the vegetables were cooked perfectly (not all come with sides though) . Appetizers are semi-expensive relative to the size, they are more proportioned to serve 1 person, we had the Brutta which was great. Dessert was Tiramisu but it was drenched in espresso so I wouldn't recommend that.  $85 (without tip) for 2.

Came in town to have dinner w friends.

Was looking forward to this all week......what a FREAKING disappointment!!!

Took forever to get a glass of water or a drink.

Then the waiter spilled water all over us and we sat with water under our feet, our seat and place mats.

They offered to moved us in the middle of dinner,but that was it. No apology from the waiter or owner. No comped wine or desert. NOTHING!

Horrible service and  WAAAAAAAAAAAY over priced !!!!!!!!!!!! Nearly a $100 per person and we left, wet and angry.

I wanted to try a different place and I'm so glad we did. The place is beautifully decorated. Our server waited on us hand and foot and treated us like family. They have a great bar that opens at 3 for happy hour. The food was delicious.  Great wood fired pizza and homemade pasta. They could use a small bites menu for people who like to try different things. But we got a Stella a chianti a homemade pasta dish and a side of lemon asparagus and a veggie pizza for 50 dollars! They also serve complementary bread and olive oil dip

Located in the corner of Eastern and Pebble next to the Colonnade Theatre, Prosecco Italian is a welcome change to that location. Having friends that recently became employees there, my husband and I decided to give it a try. 
Arriving around 9 we were immediately seated. Red shade lighting hangs overhead and setting is slightly intimate. 
Cocktails orders placed and add bruschetta, the cocktails came and were stiff, bruschetta on crispy Ciabatta with delicious yellow and red heirloom tomatoes with a zesty seasoning was a good start to the meal. Food ordered, squid ink spaghetti and prawns, and Chicken Marsala. 
I'd requested the prawns in a spicy fra diavlo sauce which he said he could do, however when it arrived it was essentially plain tomato sauce, totally void of any sort of heat. The prawns were huge though, I must say. My hubby's Chicken Marsala was pretty tasty, accompanied with baby carrots and a handful of green beans, artfully arranged on a long rectangular plate. 
Service was attentive and friendly. The owner (I think he said his name was Giuseppe) came over briefly and introduced himself.
Dinner minus tip was $122. Kind of steep for two at a strip mall Italian place, but I would consider returning. I like supporting small mom-n-pop places.

The foods & the services are good when you dine-in. When you order to take out the the service is bad. We called 20 minutes before we get there, but when we get there we still have to wait 25 minutes. They didn't prepare the order until we get there and pay. It seems to me they only take care of people dine in. I still like to eat there sometimes even though I gave them 2 stars only.

Everything here is excellent. The carpaccio is a perfect starter never to miss. We had the ravioli formaggi & the seafood linguini. Both were excellent. A definite stop if your craving great wine & some beautifully executed Northern Italian fare. Thank you Chef Danielle.

So we came here at the end of brunch kind of sad because the only vegetarian option they had was a pizza I think, which would have probably been phenomenal! But we were about to leave but they handed us a lunch menu so we could see what else they had and they had a vegan pasta that is absolutely amazing, I'd order it again and again and it's angel hair which is my fave! They also do have vegetarian friendly food too! And gluten free. It's a very modern food type Italian when it comes to health concerns which is the best thing ever. The raviolis my mum got and she finished them and she never finishes them! Anyways. Hands down amazing. Can't wait to come back for dinner and get down in food. 
The olive oil bread dip does have anchovies, so if you don't eat meat, be ware, but mum said it was amazing!!! 
Love this place already. Thank you for such amazing food and service! Recommending all my family, friends, and clients to come here too.

I was recently in New Orleans and attempted to find good Italian food, not so lucky.  I couldn't wait to get back to Vegas and make reservations here.  The food is amazing,  if you're visiting it's highly recommended to get off the strip and dine at a locals favorite.  I would recommend making reservations,  as on the weekends they are packed.  Trust the locals on fantastic food, you will enjoy the experience and dream of the food when you return to your home town!
Best place ever ! Went there for my bf and I anniversary and it was such a great experience. The food is amazing and they went above and beyond to make sure we were taken care of.

This place is new, and it's a hidden gem.  Drop everything and make your way over there right away.  

The menu is familiar in some ways, but nearly every dish has a fresh twist.  I enjoyed the fettuccine with braised short ribs--a combination I've never seen before, and I'd go back for more tomorrow.

We met the chefs enjoying their own late night meal at the bar.  They're both Italian and well versed in the local eating scene.  Their motto, "You eat what we eat."  And they eat very well indeed.  

P.S.  Ignore any claims of poor service.  Marco (and Joachim!) made us feel as though we were in their own home for dinner.

This place is fantastic!!! From the minute you walk in, until the moment you walk out the door. The whole staff provides excellent service. The food is absolutely fresh and delicious. My daughter, her friend and I truly enjoyed the whole experience.

I sat at the bar as a last minute decision. The dining area was full and busy. I was pleasantly directed around the corner and chose a seat. I was instantly and happily greeted by Tracy. She is a certified sommelier and got my taste immediately. The delicious suggested wine followed by the tastiest wagyu burger I've ever had was well received. Giuseppe, the owner, is hands on, and checked in on every table personally. The ambiance, service, and quality are top notch. My mom owned/ran a very successful restaurant, so I don't say this lightly. 
I'm a forever fan of Prosecco.

My new all time favorite Italian restaurant!

Service, food quality, ambiance, and menu were all on point. 

Prosecco servers treat you like family when you dine at their establishment. 

Their bread and tapenade are to die for to start - don't skimp or pass on their bread you will regret it!

Their have a good wine list and an extremely reasonable bottle of prosecco on their list for the table. 

Their pastas taste home made.
My favorite is the rosemary infused short rib pasta. 
Charred octopus grilled perfectly al dente.

Outdoor patio available.
Full bar available. 

My go to Italian restaurant of choice moving forward
My new favorite Italian restaurant. Home made pasta, music on the patio..terrific. Check it out, you won't be disappointed.

There are not enough good things to say about Prosecco. My fiancé and I started to make this restaurant a monthly treat. Like previous reviews stated, the entire menu seems to be truly authentic Italian food made from scratch. I've had the mushroom ravioli, shrimp ravioli, and cheese ravioli, all AMAZINGLY delicious. I've also had the steak, sooo delicious. I highly recommend this place! Love the patio, too!

Came in here for an early lunch on a Monday morning because the wife had a craving for tiramisu. I thought the place seemed oddly familiar - 3 years ago when I came out this way it was a dark and dingy pizza joint and now it's a bright and beautiful Italian restaurant.

We were very quickly seated and greeted with a warm welcome. There were two servers working at the time and they were very polite and attentive.

We ordered ravioli, a pasta with bolognese sauce and a pizza for my 2 year old. The ravioli and pasta flavors were amazing, you could definitely tell they were freshly made. As a precaution though, their sauces seem to be a little heavier on the wine content than most other places (but I didn't mind!) The pizza we got for the kid was HUGE for a kids meal, and was oddly topped with a handful of fries - which was a little weird.

Oh, we also had the calamari appetizer - the portion size was great and it was fried to perfection (with clean oil) and served with a slightly tangy but light marinara sauce. I don't normally like marinara because it's so thick and chunky at most places, but I feel they really perfected it for this appetizer by keeping it on the lighter side. 

You could really tell that this place pays close attention to detail - from the homemade croutons, to the amazing olive oil dipping sauce for the bread, all the way to the completely spot free glasses they pour your drink in.  This was a truly wonderful casual lunch experience. I hope their dinner service is equally as good because I want to go back and try the seafood linguine!

In summary, it's a wonderful local Italian restaurant that really hits the spot.  Keep up the good work!

Oh My God! This restaurant is a gem tucked into the Regal Plaza at Eastern and Pebble. My husband and I celebrated our 27th wedding anniversary with friends here. The waiter and entire wait staff were fantastic from the hostess to busboy.
The food... I'm Italian so I'm used to good Italian food. I ordered one of the specials which was a veal chop with potatoes and carrots. I could have gnawed on the bone! Hubby had the lobster shrimp ravioli and he cleaned his plate. My friends husband had a huge piece of lasagna. I've never seen him eat that much and that fast! My girlfriend had the Chicken Marsala and enjoyed it very much . Then Tiramisu, creme brûlée and a strawberry crepes! I thought pricing was good, not cheap but won't break the bank either! Go to this restaurant!
First time and not the last!  They serve you bread with olive oil dipping sauce. The food is made fresh! The food tastes great! It is authentic Italian! Friendly atmosphere!

If I could give ten stars I would. Beautiful atmosphere. The staff is so genuinely nice. Never once were our glasses empty. Tables were cleared quickly. The owner walks throughout the dining area greeting his guests which is a plus in my book. Even the chef would come out at times to say hello. Very family friendly feeling. Now the food? Wow! I am Italian and my family is from Bari Italy and let me tell you? Venetian food (Venice) it melts like butter in your mouth. Just like being home in the old country. Wonderful selection of wines. This will be our home away from home from now on!

On Saturday night we dined here with friends. The food was pretty good, but I'm still cringing at the awkward service. 

This is obviously the hot, new spot. I made reservations for 6:00 and I'm glad that I did because the restaurant filled up quickly. OpenTable didn't show availability, but when I called the restaurant they took my reservation.

Let's start with the food since this was pretty good. To begin we were given a bread basket with a sauce that looked like pesto, but seemed to be made with olives. The sauce was tasty and a nice step up from the usual bread or oil for dipping. 

I began my meal with the Ruby Salad. I really liked this salad and the portion was large, too large for me to finish. The beets were tasty, the salad dressing was delicious, and the goat cheese was the perfect amount to round out the flavors. The Scampi Paprika didn't disappoint. The paprika sauce had a nice flavor and I enjoyed the simple spaghetti served with the shrimp. My husband had the Salsiccia e Rapini all Cabrese (sausage) and he said that he liked the dish. For dessert I had the Tiramisu. It had a nice flavor and was okay, but it wasn't something I would order again. 

It's not often that I say this, but the food was overpriced. The Scampi Paprika was five pieces of shrimp with spaghetti so $29 seemed a bit steep on this dish. Even my husband's sausage dish seemed overpriced at $18 for a sausage with broccoli. Starters and dessert prices were comparable to what other restaurants charge.

I'm sorry to say that the service is the main reason that I probably won't return. I wanted to like this restaurant since it's close to home and located in a parking lot that is simple to access. It started with the wine. Long story short, our friend asked if they had Moscato and the server said yes, but returned with Riesling in the hopes that she wouldn't notice. The wine was served by a different person which made the situation more awkward and he was rather pushy with trying to get her to take the wrong wine initially. He ended up backtracking and insisting he would take it back if she didn't like it, but he'd already pushed quite a bit by this point. Through the evening it didn't seem like we had a dedicated server. I've seen the team approach at other restaurants and it works, but here it just began miscommunication after miscommunication which made the whole experience feel awkward. At the end of the meal a gentleman came by to ask if we could repeat everything we ordered so that he could prepare our checks. What? Why didn't the person that took our order share that with him? It was, you guessed it, awkward. 

Overall, the food was pretty good and we enjoyed the evening with our friends, but the service soured the overall restaurant experience.

Although we waited 15 minutes before anyone came over to acknowledge us the manager and waiter deeply apologized for what happened and everything from thereafter was a great dining experience. The food we had was UNBELIEVABLY AMAZING!!! I had the special Osso Bucco with Saffron Risotto, my wife had the Cioppino, my girls shared a pizza and pasta with meat sauce. We have found our new Italian restaurant to eat at and it is close to our house will definitely be back!!!

Loved the fresh pasta and fresh bread. Everything my fiancee and I ordered was delicious, from beginning to end. Very cute restaurant. Nice little place for date night. We will definitely come back and recommend this restaurant!
Great authentic Italian food.  They had live music on Sunday for Brunch which was a nice touch.  We will definitely be back.

Everything was delicious! Excellent service and great atmosphere. I believe the gentleman was the owner he was very attentive to us. Our waitress also gave us some great recommendations. We will be back. I'd also like to comment on how nice their hostess Krista was- she managed to get us a table for a party of 8 on a Saturday night with 20 mins notice.

I take my wife and kids rather often to this place and I have never been disappointed. Staff is super friendly and accommodative (kids make a mess) and the food is always top notch. I usually go for the items on the daily special menu but I highly recommend the Ruby beat salad and the Carpaccio. Outdoor seating is nice and the interior is modern and very nice too.

First time visit and I LOVE this place! The food is exquisite, the prices are quite reasonable and the service is flawless! Giuseppe (co-owner) really took care of us when we went for Mother's Day dinner, making us feel like family, not just another table of patrons. He patiently guided us on our individual orders, including the bottle of wine (a smooth & tasty chianti). When I confessed that I couldn't decide between the filet mignon and the filet medallions with mushroom sauce (non mi piace il funghi), he suggested that I should get the tomahawk. Although I love a good steak, but having never heard of such a cut, I told him that I don't know what that is. "It's wonderful. That's all you need to know," he assured me. When a server (or owner) of a restaurant boasts emphatically about the quality of something particular on their menu, I have learned that such advice is prudent to take. A tomahawk is a jaw-dropping sized hunk of beef at the end of an approximately 18-inch bone (I regret not taking a picture of it to show you before I dove into it.) And it WAS incredible, just as Giuseppe had promised. He told me that it had been aged for 80 days, but all I know is that it was absolutely the best steak I can EVER remember eating! I also got the ruby salad, which, if you like beets and goat cheese, you will love! My wife got the salmon in a lemon-based sauce with a prawn that arrived at our table looking magazine-perfect, and she said it was delicious. We also ordered the minestrone soup, which we thought was perfect. My brother ordered Branzino (sea bass) ravioli in a lemon butter sauce. Delicious, perfect portion. For dessert- Bavarese al Prosecco e Fragole (creamy delicate prosecco custard served with coulis) and another similar custard item, creme brûlée, both of which were as outstanding as they were beautiful. There's something for everyone on this menu. I felt somewhat remiss in not ordering something more typically Italian, but I have no regrets about my tomahawk (other than not taking a picture of it). And I can always order something like that next time. Can't wait to go back! Grazie, Giuseppe!

Delicious dinner, attentive staff.  Tried the Chilean sea bass w/lobster sauce special and lemon pasta dishes, both fabulous.  The apps, dessert and wine list weren't disappointing either! Will be back!

Hands down the best Italian restaurant! We came here because I've been craving pasta for days and I specifically wanted carbonara..which is not easy to find. So looking through their menu I had a few options that caught my eyes but I was still stuck with the carbonara cravings, lol. So we asked our very courteous lady named Ronda if it was possible for them to make me a carbonara anything and that it was ok if it was not possible. Yes! Shortly after I had in front of me the BEST and most flavoured carbonara dish on earth! It was perfect!!! My husband got himself something I cant remember the name but it was also amazing (Yes, I tried it!). 
A few things I want to point out besides the amazing food are the amazing decoration, this place is very inviting and beautiful, I absolutely love the images on the wall and the lamps; the  ladies room, I have never seen a restroom so fancy in a restaurant, and clean!!! 
Also, the staff, everybody is very friendly and attentive and the chef is the best! Ronda and him made our  visit special!

This place is a must go to for the pasta lovers!
This is a really pretty place with great food and impeccable service. They have fresh dishes with great flavor and a brick oven for pizza. Vegan and vegetarian options as well.

If you'd like to be treated like trash this is the place to go! Worst experience in dining . We were excited to try this restaurant since we'd heard great things about it but I will make sure everyone knows what lack of customer service is provided here! 
I originally reserved a table days before to ensure our seats. Unfortunately they didn't listen to me when I told them the amount of people. When we arrived and they realized it was a smaller party they hurried us out of the original table we were seated at to move us to another. The way they rushed us like cattle was upsetting. The server was abrupt and lacked of personality from the moment he asked what we wanted to drink he acted as if we were a bother to him. The server and the owner treated us as if they thought they were better than us.

This is not fine dining! This is a local business so act like it! Treat people as you'd like to be treated. Las Vegas is known for customer service and this restaurant sure missed the mark. 
As I was leaving I told one of the employees that I would be speaking to upper management and he laughed at me and let me know he was the owner. He sure didn't act like an owner, an owner would be sincere and apologetic and would try to improve the situation not antagonize the guest. 
The only apology we got was from the hostess who mistakenly reserved for a larger party. It's too bad we didn't get to try the food here but I won't be coming back here or recommending this place. I'm disgusted with the way my family and I were treated.

My first time dining here was incredible, and I forgot to write a review so here are my two reviews for my experiences at Prosecco. (Yes I came back within 2 weeks because it was THAT GOOD.) 

First time:
They serve complimentary warm bread with pesto which is to die for. No shame that I ate almost the entire mini-loaf of bread and left one piece for my partner. 
Ordered Burratina as an appetizer. It was delicious, fresh, and plated beautifully. The prosciutto was crispy and delicious. I could have eaten an entire meal of just that. 
For my entree I had the Agnolotti alla Piemontese which was one of the best pasta dishes I've had in a long time. The ravioli were clearly handmade and the creamy truffle sauce was rich and flavorful. I made sure to use every last drop of sauce because it was so delicious. 
We shared a bottle of Prosecco which was chilled and refreshing on a hot summer day. The atmosphere was nice and we had an amazing time dining here.
The owner came to the table and we mentioned a hilarious review we saw on Google about a delivery driver hitting on someone's wife. We laughed while reading it, but the owner was distraught. He told us they use GrubHub for deliveries and this person was not affiliated with Prosecco at all and was NOT an employee. He was extremely sad that this bad review brought down his overall rating, which shows he cares about his customers and his reputation. He chatted with us a long while & offered us some Limoncello on the house. 

Second time:
We enjoyed our last meal so much we decided to come back for dinner again within two weeks of our last time dining here. This place is truly a hidden local treasure. 
We once again ordered the Burratina (the fresh mozzarella and crispy prosciutto will have you coming back for more too, I promise.)
I once again ordered the Agnolotti alla Piemontese because like I said before, I have not had such a rich and flavorful pasta dish in a long time. It may not seem like you get a lot of ravioli, but they are extremely filling and both times I could not finish my meal. 
We shared a bowl of muchroom risotto which was probably the best risotto I have ever had. That is a bold statement because my mom makes awesome risotto (sorry mom). We DEVOURED the enormous bowl of risotto like it was nobody's business. 
My partner had the Branzino fish which he finished so fast I wondered if he even took a breath between bites. 

We love this place, it's one of our new favorites. We will continue to come back here for dinner. I have a feeling this is one of those places that no matter what you order, the food will be good. The staff are actually Italians at straight from Italy, the hospitality and service are amazing. Definitely recommend you give this place a chance!

I heard amazing things about this restaurant.  I can now personally confirm.  The homemade pasta and every sauce we had was Delish. The prosecco salad, beet salad and the caprese salad were all wonderful .  Claudio suggested the best of everything. Highly recommend this local restaurant.  WE WILL DEFINITELY BE BACK

Tonight my hubby and I ventured off (literally around the corner) to try a new dinning experience. We were pleasantly surprised to find this upscale Italian treasure. The staff greeted us with smiles and welcomed us in. So nice to have the choice of indoor or outdoor dinning, we chose indoor to soak up the ambiance. Which has an open floor plan so your able to take it all in, while soft Italian music plays in the background. Now for the food, which is what brought us there in the first place. The waiter told us the Chef's specials which had me change my mind and go with Chef's stuffed veal chop, my eye's are rolling back in my head, so delighted with this choice. My husband chose the fire roasted Lasagna. I'm sad to say he told me MY Lasagna doesn't hold a candle to this. But happy we found a new favorite Italian restaurant in our neighborhood.
Wow!!! Amazing food fresh and warm!!!!!! Order today and 3  times before delivery, delicious!!!!

Oh my lord! Italian dining heaven  I don't know if there are enough words to describe how impressed we were with this place. The staff was so friendly, attentive without being obnoxious, the manager greeted us personally (which is pretty great for an average Joe). They even customized my husband's order to appeal to his request for a cream sauce. The quality of ingredients and the flavor combinations will not disappoint! Make this your only place for Italian food.

Ordered delivery last night, the lasagna and the eggplant parmigiana.  The lasagna was pretty good as well as the pasta that came with the eggplant.

The eggplant parmigiana was not good at all.  It was very bitter, very chewy and just did not taste good.  My wife was not able to eat it and if we had been in the restaurant, this is a dish we would have sent back, but unfortunately we were at home.

I do like this place, we've been here several times and have never really had a bad dish until last night.

I guess this is one dish we will stay away from next time.

You know when you found someplace special , when because you have been traveling or  for other reasons you have not been there recently.
Then you come back and it's like your family welcoming you home.
Please, if you have not yet  enjoyed the food here, try it. This is our home away from home. I feel so blessed that in five short minutes I can get away and feel like I'm on vacation . And more importantly with friends. Ciao.

Prosecco Fresh Italian Kitchen is a must try. The staff was very polite, non-pretentious and always knew when we needed a refill on our drinks. 

First we were served some fresh hot bread with a side of I believe it to be a pesto like olive oil. 

If you like beets, the beet salad was wonderful, combining just the right amount of beets, goat cheese and candied nuts with a light dressing on a bed of greens.

Second course; was the butternut squash ravioli's in a sage butter sauce, Also equally delicious.

I would have liked to try their desert but I was to full but will be going back again.

Great for a casual, yet sophisticated date night, great lighting with a nice ambiance. Prices were reasonable but not cheap either...for the quality of the food, prices were fair. Look to spending for 2 people with drinks, appetizer/salad, entree and shared desert at least $100.

Get off he strip and head towards 215 and Eastern. Close drive from tourist traps on strip. Most amazing Italian food in town! Totally worth the drive... you will not be disappointed. Promise!!! Great wine list to accompany homemade daily pasta entrees. As local, 2nd visit here and will be back again!

I have had great food in Italy and for the most part haven't had anything close to what I remember. My meal at Prosecco was fantastic! The lasagna was awesome. Service was great. Really great food. Totally surprised there is this level of quality Italian food in Vegas.

We went here for Valentine's day and I have to say the service was great, the bread and Olive tapanade was very good, salad wonderful... I am unfortunately deducting stars for the main dishes. Because it's an Italian restaurant I ordered a pasta and seafood dish. The dish was very salty with the pasta sauce tasting very bland and smooth similar to a jar. I was also disappointed that the Parmesan cheese that they bought to the table was not the same shaved real cheese that was on the salad..it was the powdery kind from a shaker. My husband had a chicken dish. He said the chicken was cooked nicely but lacked flavor. I would come here for a lunch salad. But this is an expensive restaurant and I feel the main dishes did not live up to what is expected at these prices.

Went on a weekday during the evening and the restaurant was almost full house! It was my first experience here and it was a pleasant one. My friend recommended this place to us. Being a pasta fan, I just had to check this restaurant out.

Service wise, my boyfriend and I had a bit confusion when we asked about the specialties and menu items. The server has a thick accent so it was more like a language barrier but I can tell he knew his menu very well. It wasn't a big deal at all. The wine list was all reasonable priced too so we couldnt miss out on a drink.

We ordered three entrees- 
Canellonni Gratinati: Very cheesy oven baked pasta. We wanted to order the alfredo but went for this instead. It was equally delicious and we did not regret ordering this instead

Bianca San Daniele: Pizza with proscruitto, arugula, and truffle oil. The hint of truffle oil was great. We had left overs so we took it home. 2nd day pizza tasted much better.

Lobster Supreme: Lobster seafood pasta!!! This one was devoured first. The lobster tail was soft and tender. I am not a pasta expert but the pasta noodles were so soft and yummy! Cant beat house made noodles.

Creme brulee: My boyfriend said he was stuffed and cant eat any more. Guess who ate more because it was delicious.... (yup). I am not the biggest fan of creme brulee just because sometimes it tastes way too sugary or you can taste the vanilla extract a bit too much but it wasn't overpowering at all! Perfect for my little sweet tooth.

We were visiting Vegas from LA.  Stopped by because of the great reviews. And have to agree with the reviews. 5/5. 

Husband and I shared the special pasta of the day with speck ham and a Caesar salad. It was delicious. 
My eight year old got the kid's menu pizza and fries. The pizza - the simple cheese pizza was absolutely delicious. The best crust - the foldable one ... like the ones I have had in Italy. But wait for it. The fries - the best fries we have ever had hands down ... the kids pizza was 12" - more than enough for three kids or two adults to share even!

Also got the capellini with pomadoro. It was simple yet so delicious. 

The wait staff were attentive - the place elegant and simple. Simply just great and hit the spot!

All I can say is "che peccato" that I haven't found this place sooner. I'm giddy at the thought that this wonderful gem is so close to home. The burrata was rich, delicate, and creamy, the heirloom tomatoes perfectly ripened, and the pasta was simple home-made, al-dente perfection. The cannoli were not too sweet just like nonna makes. A nice limoncello (or 2) to wrap things up and aaaahh! Can't wait to be back. Delizioso.
This place kinda classy food is good I order Bruscheta with prosciutto on the side Spaghetti with meatballs and basil not bad at all a little bit pricey but worth it.
We are picky especially when it comes to Italian food. (My husband is Italian and a chef).. This place has earned our loyalty :) great food, great ambience, amd great service!

What fresh flavors. Made reservations here based on Yelp and Open Table. Great decision. Not busy for Sunday night dinner. Caesar salad was only so so part. We had Koranic salad and insalata Prosecco. Both were so fresh and delicious. We had salmon, Chilean sea bass, and angel hair pasta. We all loved it. Top 2 picks- Chilean sea bass and insalata. Yummmmm!

In moving to Henderson, we were lamenting the loss of all of our favorite Summerlin and Central Las Vegas restaurants. We found Prosecco on the first night of our move and we could not be more thrilled. The texture of the homemade pasta is perfect and everyone loved their meals. We ordered from them three times during our first four nights in the new house.

Definitely recommend this place. Very fresh Italian food , food was delicious! On top of the delicious food, the customer service was amazing! You can tell the owner cares about about his guest. I will definitely will be coming back!

What an excellent restaurant this is. Lovely decor, friendly staff, and amazing food. My wife and I loved the fact that they time your food appropriately, they don't rush your meal out right when you get your appetizer.  My wife had the oso bucco which was soft, came right off the bone and amazing. I had the linguine Mediterranean which was filled with fresh seafood. The tiramisu was the best I had ever had and the cordial was a delight to top off the meal. A great restaurant to have a wonderful evening with friends and family. Looking forward to returning to try other menu items.

First time here! Saw it on Yelp and decided to try it out as the photos of all the food looked amazing.
The inside was much nicer than I anticipated & we were seated promptly. We came in around 5:30pm on a Wednesday so it wasn't too busy.

The server was very nice and the busser was awesome he kept refilling our water so quickly. 

Cajun shrimp pasta was awesome! It was a white sauce and their seasoning was so good not too salty but so much flavor. The shrimp was served on a skewer and they were charred and delicious!

 Fettuccini Tocca with short rib (beef) was a red sauce and very flavorful, a little more heart. The beef was tender.

We also got the grilled octopus appetizer which was soooo good!! We also got the tiramisu for desert along with the cappuccino. Although they don't have milk alternatives...

All in all the service and food was awesome.
The only reason I couldn't give this place a 5 star was that l, the owner/manager there, greeted and checked in with all seated and newly seated tables while we were there. He checked on them asking how their service was, food, even having small chats with a few regarding wine and such. Never once did he approach our table. He even stopped by the table next to us just to say hi and see how the guy was. New tables of families were seated and be greeted them all. I just thought it was odd and rude that for whatever reason, not once did he ever stop by our table to say hi or ask how everything was. I even mentioned it to my bf who said that he noticed as well. That kind of rubbed me the wrong way...I mentioned it on a note card they provided with the bill...so hopefully in the future it's something they can keep in mind. If you're going to treat your customers and build that relationship and atmosphere, perhaps that should be done with all. As it seemed they did, with ALL, except one!

Never knew this place existed despite it being open for several months. The food, service and atmosphere all were A+. We started with the calamari appetizer and a Caesar salad. The flavors were great. The bread that came with the meal was freshly baked and accompanied by a great olive oil, pesto, olive and anchovy concoction that was tasty. I had the Rigatoni Paesana  and my wife had the Pasta Mediterranea. The pasta and ingredients were super fresh and flavored perfectly. Overall this was a great experience with a super friendly and attentive staff. I would put this up there with any of the fine Italian dining found on the strip.

We went here early on a beautiful Saturday evening, around 6pm, and asked for patio seating.  They had plenty available, and we were seated immediately. The staff were very attentive from the host to the bussing service, and they had a large variety of specials on the menu.  The wine was overpriced, but the food was very good! I will be returning!

Great Italian food.
While driving back from boulder to Vegas we decided to give Prosecco a shot and we were not disappointed.
They started us out with their amazing house baked bread served with an incredibly tasty olive spread; which I could have eaten 4 baskets on my own if you let me.
For appetizers we had 2 orders of the Bruschetta and a Calamari Dorati- a perfect start.
For the Insalati we ordered two:
1. the Heirloom Caprese, the Burratta (mozzarella) was perfectly creamy and salted and the heirloom tomatoes were tender and sweet and the EVOO they used was of the highest standard.
2. the Ruby, which is abeet salad with goat cheese, pecans, and greens drizzled with a sweet vinaigrette. The perfect combination of sweet, bitter and crunch
We loved both
For dinner we ordered family style:
Margherita Pizza - this I did not get to taste my 15 year old devoured it before i looked up. He said it was good
