Agnolotti di Zucca - a pasta filled with butternut squash and ricotta cheese in a sage sauce. Light and delicious
Tagliatelle al Salmone - pasta sauteed with salmon and in a vodka sauce. Perfectly cooked pastawith just the right amount of cured salmon and vodka sauce not to overpwer it.
Spaghetti e Polpette - spaghetti and meatballs. The pasta was a perect al-dente the meatballs very tender and the marinara scratch made
Fettuccine Tocco - fettuccine with braised short ribs. OMG the short ribs were so tender you could eat it with a spoon
We finished dinner with 3 desserts and coffee:
Cannoli - reminded me of little Italy NY
Banana Nutella Crepe - you can't go wrong with Nutella
And the chef's special an Apple crisp served with a Tahitian Vanilla Gelato.
We enjoyed everything here. The food, the service and the ambiance is 5 star

il migliore - the best.  Loved it and why did I wait so long to come here.

1.  This location, 21 years ago was an Italian Restaurant called Round Table Pizza. Ate there once and always wondered why it was always empty.

2. About 3-4 years ago, another Italian restaurant opened up, called Gabriela's Italian Grill and Pizzeria.  It had a nice decor, nice dessert area and a beautiful kitchen. Ate here twice.

3.  Today in the last year, Prosecco opened up with two guys from Italy opening it and I wanted to try it for a long time. It was THE BEST!

Food -  We went for lunch and they have some great lunch specials for a reasonable price that includes soup or salad.  However, I asked if we could see the dinner menu and if we could order from it.

Pulpo - For an appetizer, we ordered grilled octopus on a bed of couscous.  So tender and tasty was this octopus that I am not sure why I usually order Calimari.  this octopus was tender and juicy.  The couscous was perfectly cooked al dente and that made the taste just right.

Veal Chop - I decided to try the Veal Chop because I have been having this at other places and found it to be a bit hard to make.  Here, the Veal Chop is on the bone and incredibly juicy, tender and flavorful.  A nice cut of Veal on the bone is perfect here and where many places make this a bit tougher, you can tell that this was a quality meat cooked to perfection.

Osso Buco - I always order this as my go-to when available to compare Italian restaurant.  This Veal Shank has meat that falls off the bone and is so succulent and juicy that you cannot believe it is meat.  I am not sure if I actually chewed it or swallowed it.  OK, joking but wow, I was impressed.

When you get great service, with great food cooked amazingly tender and juicy, what more can you ask for as a great meal?  I say check the place out asap!

You will look up.

I really enjoy taking my wife here for dinner. The owners are always on site. The servers are always friendly and accommodating, and the food is excellent. Even with all of the choices in Las Vegas Prosecco is one of my favorites.

My husband and I came here for our anniversary tonight. This place came highly recommended so we decided to give it a try. It was pretty slow in there so we were greeted by the server quickly & he got our drink order. Nothing crazy, just some waters & an iced tea. Then he quickly went over the specials, which didn't seem to special just like slight variations from menu items. We ordered the Burratini appetizer and a ruby salad. They came out relatively quickly & tasted great. Then we ordered our entrees. I got some raviolis & my husband got the special filet medium rare. My food was good, there was one tough piece of asparagus, but whatever, the rest was good. My husbands steak, however, was over cooked. When the server came over, he informed him the steak was over cooked, the server kind of froze and another server came over, the steak was brought back to the kitchen where the cook poked at it, then she brought it back & said "it looks pinker in the kitchen light". My husband was so shocked he didn't know what to say so he just decided to eat it. My husband didn't want to cause a scene, but he's a chef, he knows how a medium rare steak should look. Pro tip: when the customer says the steak is over cooked, YOU GET THEM A NEW STEAK. Don't argue, that's not cool. Dinner started off well enough, but we won't be back. Bad customer service.
My favorite little spot to go. Fine dining without the hassle or cost . Very lovely vibe!
Fantastic ambiance, good food, and great service on the patio tonight! And live saxophone! Loved it!! Will be back soon.

Came here last night for an Easter dinner outing with my fam... an elegant and trendy but also comfortable and relaxing bistro. Menu is diverse, wait staff are cordial and courteous, and food was delish.... overall wonderful experience and will repeat when back in town visiting fam.

Nicely greeted and decided to sit on patio for lunch.  Patio has plenty of outdoor seating and big umbrellas, succulents. Very nice waiter with Italian accent. I hope they get more bushes and trees to block parking lot and give it a garden-type ambiance.  Lunch included margartia pizza and salad w/mango - both very tasty.  Mango was delicious, butter lettuce & avocado fresh.  Pizza had the right amount of cheeze, not too salty. I also received a tray of oil & chopped basil & fresh warm bread-- both delicious and aromatic. I put the basil-oil mixture on my pizza. After lunch, sat at bar. Two big TVs for your watching pleasure.  Wide variety of drinks and good wines.  Beers on tap.  I liked the red chandeliers over the tables near the window.  I am looking forward to my next visit.

Found this place on Yelp...I was looking for someplace new, that wasn't a chain restaurant. DELICIOUS! Nice wine selection, absolutely authentic dishes that taste like they came out of grandma's kitchen. Ambiance is appesling, service was great. Give it a shot! You won't be disappointed.

We had not been her in at least six months and i must say, it was better than i remembered. The service and food were excellent.  The only negative was that in felt a bit rushed when our meal was completed. We brought friends for their first visit and they ere impressed and can't wait for another meal. Worth the money for sure.

The food here was actually wonderful. Compliments to the chef. I had the moon shaped pasta stuffed with squash and a sage sauce. My boyfriend had the surf n turn. We were both really happy with the flavors and quality. Our waitress was very polite and friendly. We sat outside because there was a nice breeze and we were the only ones out there so it as really nice and private. The only thing I wasn't crazy about was the hostess kept calling me ma'am (most women do not like that so I am not sure why it is done). But I am not going to deduct stars because the food was so good and everything else went so well.

Go!  This place is so delicious!  The quality of food was superb and the flavors layered. This is not your average Italian dinner, it is several steps up. Prosecco is a wonderful local restaurant that makes fine dining food with a lovely atmosphere. They have crafted cocktails, chef specials and traditional dishes served with a little extra flavor and flair. A great place for a nice weekday dinner but also nice enough for a fancy night out.
This is a new Italian restaurant on Eastern and  Pebble.  The food, service and atmosphere was amazing.

OMG! 
This place is AMAZING!!!

My wife does not cook and we eat out every night. I've been to practically every restaurant in Las Vegas and with out a doubt this is the greatest meal I've EVER had. 

The best fresh pasta ever! Including my trips through Italy. Amazing staff amazing food.  My extreme gratitude and appreciation to the Chef the owner the manager and the waitress.  

WOW! Is all I can say.  Just simply WOW!
Place is perfect!  Food is amazing, Service is amazing and the Price is on point.  So happy to have discovered this place, and so happy it exists.

Surprisingly wonderful Italian restaurant we sat on the patio and the weather was so nice. Their pasta is truly homemade we had the Fettucine Tocco which was ribbon pasta with braised short ribs unbelievably flavorful and the Agnlotti alla Piemontese a stuffed pasta filled with porcini mushroom and ricotta cheese with creamy black truffle sauce. AMAZING. I normally never indulge in pasta but this was truly so good and am so glad to of experienced what homemade pasta tastes like. Our appetizer was the octopus carpaccio and it was huge in portion and so delicious. The octopus was infused with lemon and a garlic sauce. To end our meal their dessert the Bravaresa al Prosecco a delicate Prosecco custard served with a strawberry coulis was light fluffy and the right amount of sweetness. Service is exceptional and our waitress Rhonda was wonderful. I highly recommend this place food-atmosphere and service was great
Love this place! Great bread, reasonable prices and nice happy hr! Lobster ravioli is awsome and great patio!

I saw the sign and decided to stop in with my husband to check out a new place. It's their first night but everything went very well. The food was good, Branzino especially flavorful and I'm a tiramisu snob and it was very good!! Nice open decor and friendly service. We will definitely be back, especially during fall for the patio.
Amazing Sunday brunch! Excellent service. Great live music! Owner Nico- top notch! We will be back!

I was Very upset with my experience. I'm from out of town and was looking for some good Italian food to take out. While searching I found this place and saw they could deliver and all the reviews were great. My order was delivered and I open everything and find I'm missing the pasta which I was looking forward to since everyone was raving about it. I called the restaurant and the women was less than helpful apologizing and saying this was her first day and I can speak to the chef , and they must of forget since it was busy today. Unfortunately this ruined my whole meal and was left hungry with a caesar salad and a piece of very oily eggplant that was not edible. I'm sure their food is good but my experience was very unfortunate

Great food, wonderful atmosphere. Great wine options. The waitstaff was very knowledgeable about the wine selection and flexible about subbing out sides. The sauces tasted super-fresh! The restaurant was incredibly busy, so there were times where we ran out of wine and water and had to flag staff over. Prices were exactly what you would expect.

This is a great little Italian spot in Henderson right by 215. It has a good sized patio as well as a very modern feel to it on the inside. The managers and wait staff are very friendly as well. We tried the Burratina as a starter and it was excellent. It was a cripsy crostini, some burrata, tomatoes, greens and a balsamic glaze. I would say that i would have liked more tomatoes as there were only 2 small ones for the whole plate and maybe add some of their great tasting homemade pesto that they bring to the table to start with bread. For main courses we tried the 4 cheese ravioli which had good flavor and the pasta had great texture. The chicken parmesan was good, although nothing that special and could have used a pinch of salt. I would have also preferred freshly chopped basil on top to just the simple placement of the basil leaves. Overall, fairly authentic Italian food for decent value and great service. Solid 4/5

Just had dinner hear today sat at the back. Perfect little restaurant had live music & food was great. I ordered a salad, mushroom ravioli, and a creme brulle & it was absolutely delicious. So glad to have come
To this place. Hostess was very sweet and welcoming & my server was aswell (sadly I did not get his name). 
Definitely worth trying out.

I came to Las Vegas with my family to celebrate my fathers birthday. We wanted something low key and fabulous without breaking the bank. This exceeded all expectations and more. The place is a fabulously decorated, pristine true Italian feel. The service from hostess to server to the gentleman serving our water, gave us warm and skilled service. The food... fresh, authentic, flavorful and exciting with every plate that arrived at the table. Beautiful bar and menu. I loved it, we will be back!

We really enjoyed our experience here. The prices were fair considering the outstanding quality of the food- the wine selection was very appropriate and the service was good and timely. The ambiance was also refreshing.

I found this place on Yelp.  Pictures looked nice, so we tried.
This was a great experience.  The food we ordered was great!  Grilled octopus with couscous was very nice!  Octopus was fresh and big!  Couscous was moist and tasty!  This was one of the best octopus.
We also oreded salad and black ink pasta.  Pasta came with lobster and shrimp.  Not over cooked and not too salty.
The manager or the owner was very attentive and friendly.
I strongly recommend this place to everyone.  Great food and service.  Great for nice dine out.

This is a vast improvement over the last establishment at the site. Service was excellent and the food is fresh and tasty. Good selection of wines as well. 
The Managers/Owners work the floor well but tend to spend more time at certain tables with I would guess "favorite" customers and seem to pass by our table and others.  That would be my only negative but after mentioning it to our server we did get a visit better late then never I imagine.
This restaurant is located in a strip mall so you wouldn't think that the place would be that nice bit it is. Food and service were great! Decor and atmosphere were kind of romantic. I recommend it.
Everything was great especially with the addition of Walter. Walter makes you feel like family. Prosecco is my new favorite restaurant in Henderson. Good Luck Walter and good move Prosecco

Wonderful meal , what a great treat by John Crist in honor of our wedding , thank you John .
The food was fantastic, the company made it even better.
Every dish was wonderful , 9 people were in our party and everyone was pleased. 
The staff was excellent and very attentive.
I recommend this restaurant to anyone looking for a great Italian dinner.

This place is absolutely amazing!  This was our second time dining here and it was once again a delicious experience.  Had dinner here last night with my husband and daughter and EVERYTHING was outstanding: the service, the food, the desserts, the ambiance.  Joaquin - BEST server in Las Vegas, hands down!  Giuseppe and Nico are super friendly and accommodating.  It's not often that you see the owners mingling with their customers and every table they visited, the guests had smiles on their faces.  

We started with the Burratina Dinner antipasti.  For dinner, I ordered the Sea Bass special, my husband ordered the Fettuccine Tocco, and my 2-year-old had the children's pasta with marinara sauce (which she loved!).  For dessert, the delicious tiramisu and gelato. 

We are planning a special birthday celebration here for my MIL and Nico took the time to sit down with us and offered suggestions on what to serve.  He created a delicious menu and we're so excited to celebrate here.

If you haven't dined here yet.....it is a MUST!!!

I had a friend coming for visiting and she likes wine, so I was looking something close from henderson and special. I looked on yelp and i found this place. This is an excellent place to relax, talk and have a great wine. They have a lot of different types of wines and the service is exceptional. We ordered 3 differents types of food and all were GOOD!! The decoration of the place is super chic and comfy. The only thing I will say is a little expensive. I think if they reduce their prices they will have more customers.

Was very excited to try this place. However a huge disappointment. Service was absolutely horrible. The waiter came over ONCE! And I said just give me the check. Food was ok, but if you're looking for average service you won't even get that unless you are some hot girl! Because they hardly ever came o we to our area for service except to take our order

Our waiter insisted that we get the tomahawk steak and come to find out it was $95 .. also it was way over cooked.. we were not asked how we like it prepared .. you can tell the owners care so much, it's such a nice place but this waiter would take a gold metal in taking advantage of the customer

This place is amazing!! Niko and his staff were extremely friendly, attentive, and accommodating. We ordered the bottomless mimosas and the "Oceanview" omlett and both were phenomenal. In terms of mimosas, I'd have to recommend the Rosini but all of them were great. All-in-all, it was a great brunch. The bartender Brandy kept the drinks flowing and really added to the overall experience. Try it....you won't be disappointed.

First time visit was Christmas Eve, it seemed like a club that everyone else was dining was known and greeted, we were put by the door and had very slow service. Manager stopped at every other table but ours did not feel welcomed. Food was good but will not go back.

The service sucked! The water I asked for didn't come for 30mins after I sat there for at least 20mins when I flagged the waiter down. I had to "order" the free bread because they never brought that out. The manager with the ponytail visited every table but ours. The food was dry. This entire dinner process took about 3 hours while I saw people come and go. Overrated and overpriced.

Their garden looks very nice. The staff is very friendly,prompt and polite. The food is to die for :)
First thing I ate was spaghetti and meetballs.
The serving is nice, presentation of the food exquisite. Ambient and atmosphere just amazing.
I got the food super fast and everything was fresh.
Warm fresh bread as an appetizer won me over.
Great place to take a date out or go with family.
Will be coming here alot. Definitely recommend :)

Awesome, delicious, friendly, light Italian fare.   Our wonderful waiter Marco did a great job guiding us through our dinner.  Chicken Marsala, Dover Sole, lasagna, shrimp scampi, calamari, bruchetta .... everyone was very happy with dinner and appetizers.   Highly recommend!

OMG! Off the hook home made italian food..would recommend this place with very high marks. Had the stuffed pork chop special and calamari appetizer. The service and atmosphere are wonderful. Our new favorite place.
Food was really good. Casual decor with a high end serving style and presentation in a strip mall. Not what I would expect, but very happy to find this place.

This was my first time here and i have to say it is one of the best Italian restaurants. Chicken fettuccine Alfredo is always my favorite thing to get and it was absolutely delicious. The staff was also very friendly. I will be coming back

Boutique restaurant. This place is uniquely decorated with a romantic ambiance. I like that it wasn't darkly lit, you can see the person across from you. The service was great, very attentive and on point. The owner is noticed helping his employees and also servicing the tables which is pretty awesome to me. 

The food is phenomenal. We had the bruschetta to share and it was one of the bruschetta I've ever had. The tomatoes were fresh and the cheese was so delicious.  They brought some bread and an olive oil with crush olives dip, which is delicious and complimentary. I've had the chicken Limone and I love it. Chicken was juicy and  with the capers and butter perfectly seasoned the chicken. Their steak and chicken Marsala were also quite delicious. My husband had the ravioli and I thought it was great even though I don't like creamy too much. Over all this is a great dining experience and we love bringing our family here.
Very good ambiance and an awesome job by the waitstaff.  They really seemed to be in concert.  The food was great, and the Cream brûlée was fantastic.  Perfect birthday meal.

In our adventures in new-parenthood, we decided to meet up family for a dinner out at this new restaurant I'd just learned about through them! 

Atmosphere - the decor and atmosphere is very warm and inviting here. Everyone was buzzing and enjoying their dinner on a Friday night, that's for sure! The waitstaff and hostesses were very friendly and accommodating as best as they could be. We did have the baby in a carseat and ended up keeping her in the booth to avoid her being tipped over with narrow space between tables. The booths were just a tad too small for 2 people and a child.

Food - The food was awesome. I had the chicken with lemon sauce and capers. It came with very fresh baby carrots and green beans and had the perfect balance of savory and tangy - it was around $21 which seemed fair for the portion size. My husband had the ravioli which seemed to be a pretty small portion for $22. My family had pasta dishes that they enjoyed. We all shared the mango salad and the quinoa salad which were both very fresh and delicious and reasonably priced around $9.

Overall we enjoyed our dinner out here. The owner came around to the tables to welcome everyone and our server was very polite and friendly to explain everything

It may be a hard place to bring kids or a baby -- it's more of a restaurant for a friends night out or a dinner out with your sweetie -- it's not super quiet though, so don't try to have a super romantic dinner here on a busy night.
I had the lasagna. It was overpriced and bland.
Great food and great service ! Very authentic Italian food and Atmosphere, we will definitely be back to try out other dishes

We went here for our wedding anniversary. The food was absolutely spot on, fairly priced too. The wife had linguine with lobster tail and I had smoked salmon tagliatelle with vodka sauce, amazing food quality and flavors. Desserts where good too! The only reason I wouldn't give them five stars is due to service front of house, it is spotty at best and seemed awkward and absent at times. The top guy Niko checked on us at the end, we told him we were celebrating our anniversary and he realized his staff had dropped the ball on even acknowledging that (was noted in our open table reservation) so he comped us two after dinner Limoncello drinks, very nice of him. A bit noisy,acoustics could be dampened. As a side note, some dishes were finished by table side service, like filleting a cooked fish table side and also fettuccine Alfredo prepared table side. Table side service is pretty cool and fun, not seen much these days. Already anticipating our return!

Loved everything about this place!
The warm bread at the beginning is so delicious. There was four of us and we had chicken parm, lasagna, sausage and the veal. We all loved our food. When it comes to the Italian food the sauce makes or breaks it for me and the sauce is outstanding.
For dessert we had the gelato the favors were so rich and creamy. The banana, Nutella crepe was worth every calorie and the strawberry crepe made my brothers day. 
I highly recommend this place. It's small so reservations are recommended especially for large groups.

My first time was with my parents. My father loved the cannellonis. I had a salad with shrimps...fresh, tasty shrimps. 
Second time with my partner tried their lunch specials....wow meatballs.

This was a good lunch spot but it was not the greatest. It was my first time here today and I don't think I would go out of my way to come back here unless I'm in the area. Our waiter was extremely nice and the restaurant had a great look overall. 

As an appetizer we got a chicken Caesar salad. When we told the waiter we were gonna share it, he was nice enough to split it into two separate bowls for a friend and I before bringing it out to us. The chicken was a bit dry and there were just way too many croutons. But on the bright side, there was just the right amount of dressing unlike most places I've been too where they don't put enough dressing. The portion was also surprisingly good even when shared with another person. 

For the entree, I got the Pollo Marsala which was chicken breast with a wine Marsala sauce over it. It came with potatoes, sautéed string beans and carrots as the side. The sauce was great but again the chicken was a bit dry. The portion was also a great size for lunch. 

Overall, great service, great look for the restaurant, but the food could've been better.
Wonderful little Italian restaurant in Henderson Nevada. The food was delicious recommend the baked eggplant.

Meh, looked good, smelled good, disappointed. 
The place has a disorganized staff, although it amusing to see cute waiters run around without a clue we went there to eat. 
The food was not that good, just average, too bad I had high hopes for this place!

Finally the neighborhood has a healthy modern Italian restaurant!  I don't like to leave Green Valley and am getting very tired of the district and don't want to go near eastern(this is between pecos and eastern) on Pebble.

Love the Patio, why don't more restaurants realize people move here for the weather? I live to dine Al Fresco!!

It has a very warm, welcoming vibe, great energy from the staff, a true Italian run restaurant.   Service was excellent but not stuffy or pushy. Our food came out in a timely fashion, the quinoa salad with hazelnuts and blueberry dressing was an exciting new twist,so sick of the ceasar salad and caprese salad. There is so much more to our culture than these cheese laden salads.  Our chicken dish didn't come out drenched in wine and butter, it was light and flavorful. 

I'm definitely going back this weekend as they invited us to come and hear the music, and I have to try one of the homemade pastas. I cant wait!  

 If your looking for a casual, healthy, Italian restaurant with a modern vibe... Prosecco is it!!

Beautiful atmosphere. Came here with my daughter around 3pm under dressed. Yet we were still welcomed and treated well. Food was great Ravioli  Formaggio and Fettuccini Bolognese and we enjoyed both. Highly recommend for a date night too.
Good location, staff is nice, the food is ok too. Not the warmest welcome when we arrived but still ok place. I wouldn't come back though.
Great food at fair prices. The carpaccio and calamari were excellent. I had stuffed salmon and it was awesome

If your looking for cheap spaghetti and plaid table tops with a wine bottle candles you will be disappointed. If you are looking for a hip restaurant with a true Italian flair then you are in luck. Atmosphere is great. Not a quiet dinner spot. It's vibrant for a better word. Wonderful set up. Open kitchen. Modern bar and great patio.  The food shows a real Italian sensibility and flavor.   The owners are more than skinny jeans. A real love for the business and the desire to please. Nico is a great guy who hopes the draw of style and friendliness isn't the only draw....they want you to love the food.  Good ingredients aren't cheap and cheap ingredients aren't good.
poor service,high prices and small portions  wish gabriellas was still there
Great atmosphere and excellent food. The ownership (Chef & Manager) are always working and want everyone to have a great time. Stop by this place!
The Best food I've had in a long time. Everything was delicious and oh so yummy. You will thank me! Enjoy

I discovered this gem randomly and now I keep going back :)
Really good Italian food - a lot to choose from, everything I had was amazing. Their soups, their appetizers (especially their octopus), their pasta, and their creme brûlée (has a different name but you'll recognize it) - everything was delicious. 
On top, everybody working here is nice and accommodating - I reserved a table for 18 this past Saturday for an event and they were very helpful and nice. We all ended up being half an hour late because of the event before and I was freaking out. I called and explained and I was very surprised how nice and accommodating they were.
I will be back. Soon!

So i had delivery in the past and it was amazing.  This time my son and I came in at last minute for dinner on a Sat nite, we were beyond impressed with the service and the food was spectacular as much as I wanted leftovers we gobbled everything up it was delicious. The price is right and the food and serious is beyond good.  It truelly was a amazing experience!!!
I liked the very modern and cozy restaurant, 5 stars for the food and good service. for sure they will return to eat

My husband and I were out in Vegas for my birthday and decided to find something more local to eat at vs the average buffet. OMG was I super thankful we did and that we found this amazing place! The service was amazing, food phenomenal and atmosphere was very relaxed. We will definitely be coming back!

The food was of good quality, but delivery took almost an hour and the pizza we ordered arrived almost cold.  It had to be reheated in the microwave and I'm sure wasn't as good as it would have been fresh and hot.  It was very disappointing, especially for the price.
Best italian restaurant in vegas , the owner his great and the chef is from italy so the food is amazing like italy. . Grazie Domenico for opening this delicious italian restaurant in vegas

Food was pretty good. I had eggplant parm with pasta. He had an alfredo dish with Cajun shrimp. The marinara was a little orange and a little too sweet for my liking, but that is just personal preference. If you like tangy sauce, you may not like it. The eggplant tasted like it had a little nutmeg. Excellent. The alfredo and shrimp. Excellent. 

They bring fresh bread after you order your drink with a thick pesto olive oil. Very good. 

We had the tuna tartare for an appetizer. Very good. 

Now, the reason for only three stars. You guessed it - service. Marco G was prompt when we arrived, getting our drinks fairly quickly.  

A few minutes later when the bread was gone, so was Marco. The kitchen area has a glass window, so you can see all of the guys in back - talking, laughing, eating with their mouths open, and showing each other stuff on their cell phones. More laughing. Meanwhile, boyfriend's drink runs out, and it's 30 minutes later and we don't have our entrees. 

I can see this being the type of restaurant where it's about Italian family (most of the men had hair to their shoulders) where everyone is one big family and guests are included. This could be okay for someone who is drinking wine and hanging out for a two hour dinner. We were not. 

Oh, and the fungus nats from the plants were bothersome. I told the girl on the way out that if they put an inch of sand in their plants, it should stop that problem. They are attracted to vinegar, which of course, I had balsamic on the table in a little bowl that I had to constantly watch. 

So overall, good food for a decent price, if you have a couple hours. We will not be returning.

Brand new Italian restaurant located in Henderson hits the spot for authentic Italian cuisine.  Friendly staff all around with a very clean and open restaurant that definitely reminds you of being in Italy.  The outdoor seating is great when the weather allows, unfortunately everyone moved inside on my first visit due to winds but I'm sure it didn't take away from their excellent dining experience at Prosecco.  Great place for a date or a romantic evening and there's even a bar to dine at if rolling solo.  The portions are just right and perfect for family style.  My first meal at Prosecco included the lobster ravioli as my entree which was delicious preceded by the mango salad which was large enough to serve 2-3 people in my opinion.  The taste and presentation of both dishes were excellent and pricing was very reasonable.  Definitely going back soon!
This place was delicious! The service was so phenomenal, and I would go back just for how I was treated.
Love the pastas and strawberry crepe! Never had a bad dish and really appreciate the friendly staff. Very attentive! Definitely recommend to anyone in the mood for Italian food.

Went with our family (10 year old included) family friendly, but really great upscale Italian.  My grandson rated the food a 5 out of 5 (because the ice cream was 90% of the vote) and the service a 5 out of 5! We all agreed with him, I had a spinach Agnolloti with butternut squash which was creamy, delicious, my son-in-law had a Chicken Parmesan that was juicy, and huge.  We will definitely be back!

Just ordered delivery from here and have to say this is a pretty good Italian joint! My girlfriend and I tried this for the first time and were pleasantly surprised about how great the food was!

We ordered the bruschetta, it was delicious, not too bad for $6! Wish there was more though! 

My girlfriend ordered the lasagna, it was good, fresh! But the portion size was small for it being $14. I ordered the eggplant, it was good, better than most Italian restaurants that either drudges it in breadcrumbs or doesn't season it well. This one was worth $14! It came with spaghetti as well!

The added bread with the garlic oil or whatever it was, was super delicious!! 

We did order the banana Nutella crepe for dessert and it wasn't bad! I didn't know there were nuts on it, but my girlfriend loved it!!

Hopefully we can go eat there next time! Try new foods!

My first time here and all the food we ordered was delicious!!! Between the 3 of us, we ordered 5 items. We scarfed down the food so fast that we forgot all about taking pictures. Its a nice spot away from the strip. Its not overly priced and the service was spot on. I'll be back for more!

We paid our first visit today to the newly opened Prosecco Fresh Italian Restaurant in the Colonnade shopping center off of Eastern Avenue. The food was amazing; the staff attentive and friendly; the decor fabulous; and the owner engaging and friendly. If you are looking for authentic, fresh Italian cuisine prepared by a chef from Venice, then this is the place. We will definitely be back.

0 for 2 with Prosecco. I will say all of the staff are very italian and very friendly, but that's where the fun ends. On our first visit we ended up walking out after no one ever came over to us after being seated. 

I only returned because my mom chose Prosecco for mothers day brunch. We arrived right on time for our 10:30 reservation. We asked for 11:00 but were told it was overbooked. Needless to say there were many open tables the entire time we were there. 

We were seated quickly and had our water glasses filled. Again it took quite a long time for our waiter to come over and acknowledge us. He took our drink orders and said he would be back for our food order. Someone else brought out the drinks while we watched our waiter visit many other tables. He did finally return. My mom ordered the strawberry crepes and I ordered the "benny and the ham", their play on eggs benedict. 

The food took a while to arrive, but that was expected for mothers day brunch. Although my mom enjoyed her crepes, my dish was absolutely terrible. Overcooked eggs on top of bland potatoes and the most dried out overcooked piece of ham I have ever eaten. The poached eggs were cooked completely through. Our waiter never returned to check on us and see how the food was or ask if we wanted drink refills. Dirty dishes sat in front of us long after we were finished. 

After two very disappointing visits to Prosecco, there won't be a third.

Great new place to dine! It was very good. Nice decor and atmosphere. 
The staff hustled! Tracy the bartender was awesome. 
The fresh bread was very nice. Large wine menu. 
Loved the  food menu. 
Had the lobster supreme. Hubby had meat lasagna. Says it was very good. Portions are large. 
A little noisy but it was Saturday night. 
The dessert looked so freaking good. 
We will be going back again. 
Took an Uber here. So that was nice. 
They have delivery too. 
Check it out! 
Reservation was easy to make. I used open table. 
We ended up sitting at the bar. We asked for that area. They have 2 TVs over the back bar.

So this restaurant is close by to my house and I've been dying to come here! A few weeks ago I came here with my friend to have an early dinner here. Upon entering the place looks open and airy. It was a busy night and we got a booth in the back area. The place looks nice and clean. The waiter we got we weren't crazy about. It looked like he was just doing his job ... not very personable or friendly. No smiles or anything. BUT the manager that walked around to each table was super friendly and personable! he seemed like he cared about his customers that comes in there.. making sure they are happy! Before we got our meals he was already at the table greeting us and being friendly. We enjoyed talking to him. 

Okay so I ordered a cafe latte to start and enjoyed the drink. The bread with the oil dip sauce was so tasty! loved eating it. Anyways we asked about the specials and opted to order one.. the fettuccine pasta with a pink sauce and a GIANT shrimp cut in half was on the plate as well. Well when we got the plate.. the shrimp was overcooked... it was hard and dry. the pasta was okay but nothing amazing. We sent it back and the manager made sure they cooked it right this time.. he even said when he brought the plates in the back and cut into it...it was indeed overcooked. The second time they made it the shrimp was cooked okay.. wasn't overly cooked. The pasta dish we opted for alfredo sauce instead tasted kinda bland... nothing amazing. Overall for this dish i probably won't order again. 

I was impressed with the manager on duty tho.. he knew we weren't too satisfied with the second dish and took 1 plate off our bill.  I honestly really wanted to like this place! i wanted to try so many other dishes they have on menu!! but this experience wasn't too great on food and service. The only great thing about this experience is the manager who was extremely accommodating to the situation. He was super nice and charming. He aims at making sure the customer leaves happy or at least not mad. His customer service skills is amazing. He was hands on throughout the night and just awesome! the 3 stars I'm rating this place is for him! 

Overall I would say that I wasn't impressed the first time coming here but am willing to come back again to see if service will be better with different waiter serving me.. and if the food that i order next will be tastier! :) I look forward to coming back for a second dining experience and maybe i can change my 3 star to a 4 or 5 star the next time around!

Raviolis and sauces are very good not generic tasting. Service took alittle too long for my preference, getting our meal took longer than 20 mins I think, maybe they are fresh made to order ? Not sure. Would not suggest ordering the Bututa Chicken, it's expensive and flavorless with some arugula on the side. My husband had to put my sauce from the cheese ravioli on top of it. The strawberry crepe wasn't the best either- too thick to be a crepe and the strawberries inside were not fresh and soupy. The special chocolate berry mouse was good on the other hand!
Overpriced, underwhelming. Garlic bread had 3 small pieces. Decaf coffee ordered for dessert had coffee grinds in it. Servers were attentive but it will not be a place I return to or recommend.

I've been here once before and I had an amazing first experience. The food was good and the service was also pretty good. So, I came here with family (6 total) we got seated pretty quickly however, it took them over 20 mins to even get us water. I even had to ask for the complimentary bread. Our server never really greeted us and if he did it was brief and felt cold. I'm also sure the owner/manager was here our entire meal and we saw him go over to every table and say hello yet he never came over to ours, not even once. I'm a little disappointed in the service and overall experience I had here during my second visit.

This place was amazing. I'm sorry it took me so long to get here. Owner and staff were all very friendly. I've been to a lot of Italian restaurants across the country and this was the first one I've ever been to that plays Modern Italian music. It was very refreshing.
 
Interior is beautiful with a lot of versatile seating for booths, seats and 1/2 and 1/2 style tables.

Bread served before our meal was great.

My husband had the eggplant parmigiano. Very good and he has been dreaming about the delicious sauce it came with ever since.

I had the sausage with broccolini and golden potatoes. Great spice and flavoring on the entire dish. I can tell they make their own sausage in house and it was the best sausage i've had in Vegas so far.

Highly recommend this place. We're certainly going to be returning here often.
